venue.name: Rubin Museum of Art - K2 Lounge / Cafe Serai

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Body Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 27-39 - 1F/1M SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
We will be meeting up at the Mali Music concert at IRVING PLAZA on FRIDAY, OCTOBER 30TH. Mali Music is an incredible R&B/Hip Hop artist that earned much critical and underground acclaim with his first two independent releases. He has now signed to RCA Records and released his first major label album, and recently earned a Grammy nomination for Best Urban Contemporary Album. He has also appeared on BET's acclaimed "Music Matters" series.


ANDY MINDEO will be performing as the opener for the show. The PRICE FOR THE TICKETS IS ~$35, and you can purchase them HERE.  Let us know if you're going so we can look for you. This will be an incredible show that you don't want to miss!

Listen to his music and watch videos at www.malimusicofficial.com.
results.name: MALI MUSIC (W/ANDY MINEO) - CONCERT AT IRVING PLAZA

results.description:
Join us for the NY Shamanic Healing Circle with Irma StarSpirit Woman this month as we hold a celebration of the Day of the Dead in honoring our ancestors, please bring pictures or your loved ones, a mask if you own one, flowers for the altar, a candle in a glass jar.

The NY Shamanic Healing Circle meets about every last Friday of the month from 7 -9:30 pm

Dates for circle are:  Oct. 30, Nov. (No Circle) & Dec. 18.

Location: YoGanesh Yoga – 208 W. 29th St, 2nd Fl., #201 (btw. 7th & 8th Ave), NYC.(door closes at 7:30pm)

Exchange: $20

Register to hold space email: [masked]

We open new doors for personal and communal healing. Experience and practice a vast range of healing modalities. As we work, we allow ourselves to be “seen and heard’ by Spirit. Bring your worries, illness and dis-ease into a Sacred Space and allow your healing to manifest.

Please bring a drum or rattle.
Have extra socks for warm cozy feet, and a blanket or shawl for comfort, water.

About Irma Caceres “StarSpirit Woman”

Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. Irma StarSpirit Woman currently lives in Queens, NY Contact her at [masked] or visit: shamanicfirereiki.com
results.how_to_find_us: nyshamaniccircle@gmail.com
results.name: NY Shamanic Healing Circle

results.description:
“Zen” is the true story of Eihei Dogen, the great 13th century Japanese Buddhist master. Dogen traveled in China and established a monastery in Japan, where the emphasis was strongly on meditation. He is considered the founder of the Soto school of Zen. This film, directed by Banmei Takahashi and starring Kantaro Nakamura, covers the whole of Dogen’s life during a time of great upheaval in Japan. It presents his interactions with his followers as well as his rivals. Here are some words of this revered Zen master:

To study the way of enlightenment is to study the self.
To study the self is to forget the self.
To forget the self is to be actualized by myriad things.
When actualized by myriad things, your body and mind as well as the bodies and minds of others drop away.
(Translated by Kazuaki Tanahashi)

Please enjoy this fascinating film with us. Bring something to eat or drink for our potluck table. Movie Night is free and open to the public. Our space is small, so please arrive on time and RSVP.
results.name: Movie Night @ Rigpa - Zen

results.description:
Hi, I am Giorgia and I want all the young people in NYC to learn how to play bridge!!! Come to our bridge club to learn the best game in the world, surrounded by people your age. Learn, have fun and meet new people :)

The meetup starts at 6:30pm, not sure it would not let me plan anything before 7pm. A buffet dinner will be available starting at 5:45pm and we will be done by around 8:30. We plan to all move to a close bar to have some drinks after the bridge lesson/play! 

I am waiting for you on the 30th but, if you can't attend for any reason, come next week! We will be there every Friday night :)
results.how_to_find_us: We are at 133 E 58th street, honors bridge club, 14th floor :)
results.name: Opening night! Show up, eat, drink and play bridge with us :)

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.
results.how_to_find_us: Please ask the doorman for the location.
results.name: Friday Night - Instructed Drawing Session

results.description:
Halloween Costume Skate 2015!

Come join an all ages costume skate from Columbus Circle to Union Square!  This is a themed group skate in the open streets.  We will be skating in the bike lane through Time Square (probably stopping for a quick photo) and then continuing down Broadway to Union Square.  Please come in dressed up, and try to incorporate your helmet into your costume.  The 3 Best costumes will receive RADnuts printed with our Ghostskate logo! 

I will send my contact info out the day before the event, please RSVP to help find the group. • Please make sure to bring your helmet, you are responsible for your own safety. 


Meeting at Columbus Circle from 7-7:30 pm


Skate down Broadway from Columbus Circle to Union Square 7:30-8:30

(Maybe 21+ hangout after?)

Happy Halloween!!

This event is sponsored by NUN - Non Universal Nuts provider of the RADnuts: Sturdy bearing protective and decorative caps for Longboards and Cruisers wheels.


http://nonuniversalnuts.com/skateboards.html

results.description:
Come join us for our annual multi-group Halloween Party. Costumes strongly encouraged. We will have music, drinks, a costume contest, games and more . . . (see below)

We have reserved a space on the 2nd Floor of Alewife in LIC. Just head up there. Contact info will be emailed. We will be joined by Life Out Loud and more . . .

Updated:

We want you to feel like it's your party, so your enthusiasm and participation is encouraged. First up, is your Costume Contest. So, if you haven't picked up a costume yet, here are the categories:

• Scariest Costume

• Funniest

• Cutest 

• Best Group or Duo

• Most Original

Organizers will narrow it down to 3 finalists with your help and then you vote for the winner of each category.

Pumpkin Pinata

One of our members has offered to bring a pinata, so we will need help filling it. Bring what you can . . . candy, small bags of chips or popcorn, get creative. Please no unwrapped or loose food items;) Whatever's inside will serve as prizes for the contest, so bring some good stuff.

Halloween playlist

We're bringing a playlist full of freaky hits, including the usuals . . . Thriller, Monster Mash . . but if you have any requests, we'll do our best to include it on the list. Leave your suggestions below.

Games

I'll bring along a Horror Movie trivia game, but if you want to play any others, mention it below.
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd Floor. Contact info will be emailed.
results.name: Halloween Party @Alewife (multi-group)

results.description:
Friends,

Join us for a fun evening this coming Friday, October 30. We will first meet for a night of mingling, drinking and more @ Suite 36.

Later that night we will go to Monarch rooftop. There we will continue the party till 4am. We normally leave the first venue @10:15pm.

Both venues are less than 5 minutes away. Doors for Monarch opens @ 10pm.

Both venues are free for our group members (mention Rory's List to the door person)

Many of our Meetup groups have been invited to this event. Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Feel free to come solo or with your friends.

Contact us if you have further questions.

We look forward in seeing you for a fun weekend.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory

Date: Friday, October 30, 2015

Venue: Suite 36

16 West 36th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue.

Subway: TAKE 1,2,3,N,Q,R, B and D train to 34th Street.

results.description:
Well, we haven't done one of the local beer festivals in awhile, so let's check out this Fall Harvest Beer Festival at the Armory down on Lexington Ave and 25th Street. 

We are targeting the Friday evening session (this is called Session I). As before, I know myself and many others will be getting the VIP package, which gets you in an hour early. Lines are shorter, you can talk to the brewers and you get an extra hour of beer.

For VIP, the session starts at 7:00 pm. For general admission, session starts at 8:00 pm. In either event, plan on showing up 30-45 minutes ahead of opening time to get in line.

Early bird pricing of $65 is currently available for VIP tickets, then it bumps up by $5-10 once the "early bird" is gone.  These sometimes sell out so plan accordingly.

As usual, I will be hand crafting my own pretzel necklace to wear and encourage others to do likewise. Based on the amount of people who admired mine at the last festival, if you want to make some extra cash, make several ahead of time then sell them to people waiting in line!

Here's the link for tickets.

http://www.nyccraftbeerfest.com/?utm_source=NYC+Fall+Harvest+EB+Ending&utm_campaign=NYC+Fall+EB+Ending&utm_medium=email

The next generation of Zionist leaders: an inside perspective on Israeli leadership. Ido Eiskovits will share an insider’s perspective on the current situation in Israel, and how Israel is developing the next generation of Zionist leaders. As an experienced Commander in the Israeli Army, Ido will share a personal account of Israel’s security situation and anti-terrorism efforts. Ido is now on the forefront of developing the next generation through overseeing JNF’s Green Horizons, a young leadership group that provides informal educational programming to 20,000 Israeli children and teens over the past 30 years. Service 7pm; speaker 7:45pm (free and open to the public)

results.description:
The Whitney Museum of American Art presents a career retrospective of Frank Stella (b. 1936), one of the most important living American artists. This survey is the most comprehensive presentation of Stella’s career to date, showcasing his prolific output from the mid-1950s to the present through approximately 120 works, including paintings, reliefs, maquettes, sculptures, and drawings

   Above:                                                                                                         • Harran II by Frank Stella, 1967.                                                             • Polymer and fluorescent polymer paint on canvas. 120 × 240     in. (304.8 × 609.6 cm).                                                                             • Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, New York; 1982 gift of             Irving Blum.                                                                                                   • © 2015 Frank Stella/Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York. 

Co-organized by the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth and the Whitney, this exhibition features Stella’s best-known works alongside rarely seen examples drawn from collections around the world. Accompanied by a scholarly publication, the exhibition fills the Whitney's entire fifth floor, an 18,000-square-foot gallery that is the Museum’s largest space for temporary exhibitions.

results.description:
Hello NYC Grassroots Alliance Friends!
Note: Our regular monthly meeting will not take place this month so we can all support the Port Ambrose hearings. Please secure your free seats on one of the FREE BUSES to Long Beach ASAP. We'd like to know in 24 hours (end of the day Friday) how many people we have on the buses, so please check those links out now! Thanks and looking forward to seeing you there!
*********************
This is it. We have one last chance to stop the Port Ambrose LNG (liquefied natural gas) port from being built off the coast of Long Island.
JOIN US at the official New York hearing for the project, located in Long Beach, Long Island:
Monday, November 2nd, 6:00 PM -
Long Beach Hotel, 405 East Broadway, Long Beach
RSVP HERE: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1JlykObaiEgIt7DDR-BwVXM-iPLk7uZuqJFJYM_TEDcU/viewform

We also have 2 free buses leaving Manhattan to get people to the hearing (if links are not live please copy and paste to browser)
1. GO HERE if you'd like to leave from midtown - 34th street and 8th avenue, 3:30 PM
http://act.foodandwaterwatch.org/site/Calendar?view=Detail&id=119561
2. GO HERE if you'd like to leave from the lower east side - 313 Bowery, 4:00 PM
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/get-on-the-bus-to-the-final-port-ambrose-hearing-no-fracked-gas-in-nyc-tickets-19302478232


Port Ambrose is a dangerous, unnecessary gas project that would bring tankers full of compressed volatile gas - tankers as long as the Empire State Building is tall - in and out of our shores. The project would put our safety, our security, our marine environment and our climate at risk, and further drive the destructive practice of fracking for gas, and the local communities have voiced their strong opposition to the project time and time again. Governor Cuomo has the power to stop the project, but before he acts, he needs to hear from you. You can spread the word on Facebook about the hearings HERE.
https://www.facebook.com/events/838384152942023

(And as if that weren't enough, first 80 people to the hearing get one of the awesome tshirts pictured below to wear during the hearing!)
Looking forward to seeing you there - together we can protect our coasts and communities!
Join all our climate activist allies in NYC to present a united front. Say NO to LNG at Port Ambrose! See you on the bus!
results.name: Deadline! Free Bus Tickets to Port Ambrose Hearing

Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

results.description:
TNYA Water Polo is an LGBTQ friendly team with practices at John Jay College Friday 7:30 – 9:00 pm, Sunday from 6:00 – 7:30 pm, and Tuesday 8:00 or 9:00 - 10:00 pm at the Chelsea Rec Center (for Rec Center members only). For full information on the team, please go to www.tnya.org. 

The first practice is free and we love getting new players! Please let the coach on deck know if it's your first time with us and feel free to message Alex Barclay ahead of time if you have any questions. You will need to bring a swim suit appropriate for water polo, a towel, goggles and a lock. If you would like to practice with us regularly, you must become registered with US Water Polo at the silver level and pay our annual membership dues.

We ask that any practice participants have some prior experience playing water polo and be able to swim a hundred yards in a row in less than two minutes. If you have a swimming background and are interested in learning water polo, please read the pdf below thoroughly and contact Alex Barclay. The coaching is typically geared to an intermediate level of play and we do work on basic skills at every practice. Everyone should be familiar with the basic rules and concepts of the game, as outlined in this pdf: http://www.tnya.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/Polo_Beginners.pdf

Practices typically include a swim set and some conditioning at the beginning, drills, and scrimmaging for the last 30-45 minutes (it's also ok to sit out for the scrimmaging portion if it's your first practice). Bob or Jeff are the typical coaches. We strive to create a positive and welcoming environment and do not tolerate any unsportsmanlike conduct. There are at least four tournaments we compete in each year and practices will adjust in the weeks before the tournaments to prepare participating players.

results.name: TNYA Water Polo

results.description:
REST / BALANCE / RESTORE
Winter is the Yin time of year; a time to go inward, slow down, and be mindful. In the first part of this workshop, I will teach a Yin yoga sequence focusing primarily on supporting the kidneys (the organs associated with winter) and the sister organ, the urinary bladder, which will help calm during this very busy time of year.

2- I will then lead the group through Divine Sleep Yoga Nidra, a guided meditation that systematically guides and relaxes you at every level of being including your physical, energetic, mental, emotional, and spiritual layers (koshas). Through the use of breath awareness, body scanning, healing music and nature imagery, Divine Sleep invites you to become aware of each layer of being without needing to change or fix anything. This is true meditation where there is nothing to do but ‘notice’ – supporting you in feeling empowered and whole just as you are.

With all the activity and busyness that surround the begging of winter, the holidays, and more, it’s easy to lose touch with our ‘inner guide’. This workshop will give you the time, space, and focus to quiet the active thinking mind so that you can re-connect with the wise part of your being. A wonderful gift to give yourself! $30
results.name: Yoga Nidra - the yogic sleep with Maria Baez-Dominguez

Join Patagonia Ambassador Pep Fujas for the Patagonia Meatpacking and Patagonia SoHo premieres of Jumbo Wild–a gripping, hour-long documentary film by Sweetgrass Productions telling a true story of the decades-long battle over the future of British Columbia’s iconic Jumbo Valley–highlighting the tension between protection of wilderness and the backcountry experience and ever-increasing development interests in wild places. A large-scale proposed ski resort threatens the rich wilderness of British Columbia’s Purcell Range – a revered backcountry ski and snowboarding destination with world-class terrain, sacred ground for local First Nations people and part of one of North America’s most important grizzly bear corridors.

<a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/patagonias-jumbo-wild-premiere-at-patagonia-meatpacking-tickets-19117506978?invite=&err=29&referrer=&discount=&affiliate=&eventpassword=#"></a>

results.description:
October is Halloween in New York. Many Caribbean people like us, have no real connection to Halloween, so to celebrate Halloween, we'll be screening Caribbean films telling stories on our Folklore. As a people, we are not too much into horro, but we are known for our humour and folklore - to celebrate them, we'll be screening two hilarious films based on our folklore - one from Antigua, the other, Jamaica. Check them out below.

Parish Bull 
by Ras Micheal Tingling 
Short Film 
Jamaica 2012

Michael is the PARISH BULL!!! Confident, charming and without scruples, Michael is not afraid to make his bed, but he may be afraid to lay in it.

Diablesse
by HaMa Films
Feature Film
Antigua 2005

Diablesse or La Diablesse as it is known in the French territories of the Caribbean is a beautiful woman whose only flaw is that one of her legs is that of a donkey.

Diablesse the movie is a humorous take on Caribbean Folklore. This is a whimsical tale of a young man who finds himself trapped in a bizarre wedding ceremony with a she-devil…it becomes a race against time to find him and save him before he says “I do”.

This is our final screening for the year - Come join us as we wrap up our 2015 season and look forward to 2016.
results.name: CaFA Film Nights - Humour + Horror Edition

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

What to Expect.
Relax. It's Easy.

 

Classes are led by experts, many with thousands of hours of experience and deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance.

 

Classes are tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques may also be explored.

 

Classes begin with a brief announcement and introduction followed by 30-40 minutes of instruction and practice. Typically, classes are no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a life time.

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

This week we will be celebrating Halloween at Rich's apt on the UES. Costumes are strongly encouraged, but only fun is mandatory, and there will be a contest with prizes. Anyone looking for more details should poke Lee.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

Having less experienced players in the more intense Sunday night setting is both unsafe and unfair to the other attendees. But all are welcome to attend Friday nights. (Use your own judgement of skill level before signing up for Sunday) 

Players are expected to be able to handle free pass, pass accurately, and most important "BUMP SET SPIKE" with every effort not to just return the ball on the other side. Regular volleyball rules will be more closely enforced

-Carrying will be called

-Doubles will be called if too obvious

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches (Bottom Net is okay)

-No going under the net on the opposite side of the court. (Safety)

results.description:
Halloween hails on a Saturday this year! Are you ready for the big unveil? Worried, perhaps, that your tresses may tumble, your garters will fail to gart, or that you'll experience a catastrophic mid-drink doo-fall? Just need some more practice walking in stilettos and a floor-length silk cape? Please join us on Friday October 30th, the night before Halloween, at Albatross Bar for our October mixer, and a chance to test out all of your costume particulars. Wear all or part of your costume as a practice run, or avoid the crowds on Saturday night and let Out Astoria serve as your de facto fright night. Costumes aren't mandatory, but they are certainly encouraged. And if you can't manage to keep everything in place, well, that can't be helped.


SAVE THE DATES:

This Wednesday the 7th, see you for our happy hour and game night at Break Billiards!

Also, please mark your calendar to join us for dinner at 3E Thai on October 20!

results.description:
Celebrate our Connection to our Ancestors and the Wisdom within you!

Healing with the Ancestors Workshop with guest Doña Leova from Mexico All are welcome to come honor ancestral wisdom, to connect to power of pachachama, Mother Earth, and to discover the light within in a grounding and healing evening featuring Sarah Eve Cardell and special guest from Mexico Doña Leova. We will journey and meet our guides, healing and releasing any energies or old stories that prevent us from being in our empowered and creative flow, perform sacred rituals to honor our ancestors and ourselves, receive divine messages and inspiration, and embrace the support of community.

Please bring any photos of your ancestors if you feel called to do so and an open heart!

Cost: $30 per person prepaid, $35 at the door.

Come with a friend or ancestor, receive a discount- Two tickets for $55.

Date: Friday October 30th

Time: 8-10:00pm

Where: The Bhakti Center 25 1st Avenue near 1st Street NYC

RSVP with paypal for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=FCDPXB2UY39TN

RSVP with paypal for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=YSQ96A69YBAZS

Doña Leova is a Traditional Healer from the Nahuatl Indian nation of Puebla, Mexico. Her work is based in a cosmology of healing that is known as the "Tradition of the Grandmothers"..... named because historically, one grandmother would share the practice with one granddaughter who would then go on to become the next practitioner. Renowned and respected for the ancestral wisdom she carries, Doña openly shares ancient rituals, healing practices and Sacred Prayers from her community in the Mexican forests. In this workshop, she will guide us thru powerful rituals and techniques to deepen our awareness of the Healing Spirits in nature and further awaken our abilities to heal, purify, protect and Bless ourselves and our loved ones. Together we will dissolve limitations and welcome Joy. Please contact Robert Carris at [masked] for more information.

Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you! www.sarahevecardell.com

All text, images, and products presented are copyright. Copyright © 2015 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved.
results.name: Healing with the Ancestors Workshop with guest Doña Leova from Mexico

At this party you will enjoy swing dancing lessons and practice, reception party and free food and open bar. Yes, open bar - free drinks until we run dry. Swing dancing will be led by a  A-town swing. No experience necessary. 

We are renting out a private space in NYC. so please RSVP so we are able to gauge the size of the studio to rent and how much drinks and food to prepare.

RSVP in advance $30 or at the door without RSVP $40.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

There will be food and drinks available to purchase. Free parking in there huge parking lot and street parking as well.

Cash Prizes And Gift Certificates Given Out To The Best Halloween Costumes That Night, So Come Dressed Up. Upwards Of $200 In Value Or More Given Out.


$10 Cover Charge. 

Prepay To Guarantee Entrance And You'll Also Be Entered In An Online Raffle To Win Free Entry To The Event.

2 Or More Lucky Winners That Prepaid Will Have There Cover Fee Refunded & Party For Free. Raffle Will Be Done A Few Days Before The Event.

The music will be a nice mix of Latin, Ballroom, And Some Top 40. Expect to hear a good amount of Salsa, Bachata, Merengue, but we'll also play Hustle, Cha Cha, Top 40, & More!

results.description:
Welsh Vampire Hunter affectionately nicknamed 'Taffy the Vampire Slayer'. He is a big fan of Buffy and always carries her picture next to his heart.

At our last meetup we discussed  Murder Mystery's and how we have not done one in in a long time. We thought that it would be fun to try this again. So in celebration of Halloween we will have a spooky foods murder mystery dinner. (Some effort in costume is required to join this, even if you slap something homemade together, let's be festive guys!)


Why are we charging for this meetup? Please note that I am not profiting off of this dinner. The game and props costs money, and to make things interesting we will also have a cash prize for the person or people who solve the murder. Depending on how many people who attend the cash prize can be up to $175, yay! So get your thinking caps on and let's have fun. *Note: these games are not easy and we usually only have one winner so that is some pretty good holiday spending cash :-) 

I know that this is after work so I will allow store bought foods at this event, but of course homemade foods are encouraged! If you do buy something from a store please make sure that it is spooky. You may arrive early 8PM and on to assemble your dish. Note that once the game starts you will not have time to assemble it. 

To participate you must bring at least one spooky food. If you would like to drink with us please contribute a bottle of wine or cocktail as well. Please make sure to post what you will bringing to the party in the comments section below.

Now for the game!

A vampire's death:

To celebrate the opening of the scary new theme park, Vampireland in Transylvania, the guests have been chosen by Jack Ular, the owner of Castle Alucard and Vampireland, to take a frightening challenge. Their challenge, if they choose to accept, is to spend a night in one of the rooms in the haunted West Wing of Castle Alucard in Vampireland. If they successfully complete the challenge, and survive the night, they will each win the sum of $10,000 and will be awarded a Vampireland Medal of Bravery.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

How the game will work:

Each member who signs up will be sent a character description, internal information about your character (Keep this a secret!), and costume/ prop recommendations.

During the party, each of you will be given clues. The clues provide all the information required to unlock the mystery. Each clue is designated as a clue to be concealed or a clue to be revealed. Conceal clues are generally information about your character that you try to hide (without lying) from the others.

Reveal clues are ones that you should share with others in casual conversation. During the party, guests will mingle around asking questions about each others character and about clues you have received.As the game progresses, you will gather more and more information and at the end of the allotted time you will need to sift through fact and fiction to decide who is the murderer.


The characters can be played to suit the comfort zone of each player. If you like the spotlight or enjoy role playing, immerse yourself in your character’s persona and live the night as you think they would. You may even decide to exaggerate your character’s personality for even more effect.

On the other hand, if you prefer to participate in a less theatrical capacity, you may want to sit on the couch and let people come to you, approach each character off to the side or just listen in on other conversations until you get your feet wet and are feeling a bit more comfortable.


Remember there are only three rules you need to do: 
1. Stay in Character 
2. Hide/Stretch the truth, but don't lie! 
3. Interrogate others

-----------------------------------------

By the way: The murder mystery dinner will run for approximately [masked] hours so plan accordingly.

Sign-ups for this meetup will close two days before the scheduled event, so make sure you RSVP before then.

You will have a chance to give your top two character choices when you RSVP on the questions form. Characters are assigned on a first come first serve basis.. You will also need to leave your email so that your character can be sent to you. Consume instructions are included with the characters and you will get the instructions in the email. 

Remaining Character Choices are: in bold, please pick a bold character. 

Ann Angrimob :Serving wench from the local village.From the local village. She works behind the bar at the local Hostelry, 'The Cross and Garlic' (A Big Stake Inn).

Count De Bodies : Film Star Famous Film Star renowned for his roles as Doctor Frankenstein, The Wolfman, The Mummy and of course, Dracula.

Dai Monsterdai: Vampire Hunter Welsh Vampire Hunter affectionately nicknamed 'Taffy the Vampire Slayer'. He is a big fan of Buffy and always carries her picture next to his heart.

Dinah Gruesomeway Horror Writer: Writer of some of the scariest modern horror stories. Always dresses in black with a veil. Not somebody you would like to meet on a dark night!!


Ivanna Bytiznek Romanian Princess and TV Presenter: She is the presenter of 'Fangs for the Memory', a cable TV programme about vampire films, myths and legends. A Romanian Princess, she is a real 'Vamp in a red dress'.

Jacqueline Hyde Supernatural Investigator: Top supernatural investigator who has made a fortune from her books and photographs including her famous photograph of the Lake Blud Monster.


Stretch: The Butler Jack Ular's butler and Castle Alucard retainer for many years. A spooky character in himself who is familiar with many of the nooks and crannies of Castle Alucard, but, like many of the staff, he has always refused to enter the West Wing of Castle Alucard, until tonight!!


 Spike or Vlad  Tire (can be played by a guy or girl)   : Passing Motorist A local villager who runs the joinery business and timber yard in the village next to Vampireland. She had decided not to come tonight but then broke down as hShe was driving past and decided to come and try to win the money. 

Celia Fate Newspaper Reporter: A cynical, ambitious newspaper reporter who is renowned for exposing frauds and hoaxes around the world. She is collecting information to write a book about monster hoaxes.

Constable Painting: Policewoman An English Policewoman who has been sent in to help the local police to try and solve the mysterious disappearance of a number of young local girls.


Igor Talocal: Gamekeeper Local Gamekeeper who has worked for Jack Ular since he bought Castle Alucard. His job is to ensure that none of the nasty wild creatures from the Dark Forest or Lake Blud get into Vampireland and upset the visitors.


Shabbique: Investigator Scruffy looking investigator who works for Mystery Investigators. Sometimes brings her dog, Shabby Too, with her.

Thelma Investigator: Brainy investigator who also works for Mystery Investigators. She loves to expose any false spooks or tricky ghosts.

Tillie Screams: Dentist Dentist who had been brought in specially by Jack Ular to look after his teeth. She also runs a dental surgery in the local village to keep her busy when she was not looking after Jack.


Questions? Feel free to message me

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
If you're still planning a costume please try to make it warm. The outdoor terrace will be utilized and it's supposed to be a low of 42° on Friday. Protect your extremities.

COSTUUUUMMMMES.

#1204 is winding up for the Eve of Halloween. We'll try to use the terrace one last time in 2015. So, you can:
1) pray for unseasonably warm and dry weather,
2) wear a costume that covers your extremities,
3) or just drink the cold away

Bring booze, bring candy, bring friends, bring ice. We prefer october/autumn/halloween/orange and black themed host gifts be brought. Maybe we'll make trick or treat themed sangria (that's just hard candy soaked in vodka IMO). Or rum spiked hot apple cider?

If you do not dress in costume you will be forced to drink in the corner BY YOURSELF. Group costumes highly encouraged. But no props/friends that can harm/soil the apartment. And no costumes that elicit whispers of "Is that {}ist?" Nobody wants to think about that when they're getting drunk - they just want to laugh about how poor your costume's construction/execution is.

While we plan to drink and eat - no other substances are approved on premises.
results.name: Halloween Eve Drinking Terrace Party

results.description:
You know those escape room type games where you have to team up with strangers to solve a puzzle in real time? I found a zombie themed one that's happening next Friday! :D

Here's the event description:

"You and 11 other adventurers will enter a room and are challenged to find the clues, solve the riddles, and get the key to escape.... or get eaten. As the clock dwindles down from 60 to 0, every 5 minutes the hungry zombie's chain gets longer and the danger zone increases. Communication and teamwork are musts if you want to make it out alive."

Tickets and info at this link: https://goo.gl/sIwlOE

Seems like it'd be much more fun with a group! It's an adventure, although quite a unique one. Anyone interested?

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.

Join Desi Fridays on Halloween eve as we take you to the HOTTEST Halloween Haunted Nightclub with zombies, creepy creatures, and ghouls... Be prepared for an unforgettable night of fun and fright!!! Watch the walls of Triumph Room transform into a twisted pathway to hell as party goers enter the most divinely sinful club in NYC.

NYC's Only Weekly Friday Night Desi-Party

presents 

NIGHT OF THE DEAD
"Annual Halloween Party"

Friday October 30th 2015.

☀ TRIUMPH ROOM☀
311 West 57th Street. NYC

♣ Music By New York's Finest: 

DJ HARSH & DJ AMIT
(Playing your favorite Desi & Dance)

RAVI BINDRA

♣ About Desi Fridays

Desi Fridays is one high society Desi Party. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desi party.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Friday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Friday Nights in NYC!!

results.description:
The Devil's Path! On HALLOWEEN

It's time to head to the Catskills to hike one of the best known,

most grueling trails on the east coast!

I can pick up at the Poughkeepsie train station Friday night. $30 get's you a ride both ways and a place to sleep Friday night. 

Fast Pace


http://www.backpacker.com/january-2011-readers-choice-northeast-new_york-devils_path/destinations/15048

Five peaks over 3500' .. 24 miles .. 9000' of vertical gain!

5am: Meeting at car spot location (Prediger Road) Everyone MUST meet here to spot cars. We will then drive to the starting point.

Everyone will hike at their own pace, the first 4 licensed drivers to complete the hike will collect the cars from the starting point. We will hide the keys at the trailhead. If you don't leave your keys you are responsible for getting your own car.

Expect to be hiking for 10-14 hours!

Since we will all be hiking at a different pace, try to find someone in the group who hikes at your pace -

FOLKS SHOULD HAVE SOME LONG DISTANCE (20 miles or more) HIKE EXPERIENCE BEFORE DOING THIS HIKE.. THERE WILL BE NO SWEEP!

+++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: A Halloween Traverse of the Infamous DEVIL'S PATH TRAVERSE!  Expert hikers only

results.description:
Due to forecasted rain on 10/3, this trip has been rescheduled to 10/31 Saturday.


Above the Clouds offers hot air balloon rides in the beautiful Lower Hudson Valley of Southern New York. 

A hot air balloon ride isn't something you'll do every weekend.
  Do it right.
  Do it with the right people!

A pilot guides passengers through the air in an eight-story-high balloon, ascending between 500 and 2,000 feet, before choosing a field for landing. Each flight ends with a traditional champagne toast.  New this year, all guests will receive a photo keepsake suitable for home or office.

After the ride, we will have the breakfast at a local restaurant together.

Why Fly with Us?

Safety: Safety has always been our #1 priority, and that's not just talk!

Insurance: Our entire operation is covered by the proper insurance. 

Equipment: A new balloon is great to look at!  That's why we replace our equipment much sooner than most ride operators.

Comfort: Our larger basket will carry up to eight passengers at a time.

The Lower Hudson Valley: Our flying area is one of the most beautiful in the country.

Depart Date (New): October 31st Saturday; arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 5:00 AM (New): (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 5:30 AM (New): (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Expect to be back in NYC at 10:30 AM and Flushing at 11:00 AM

Cost: Early birds $219 (retail price: $289 = $250 + $39 transport) for first 4 spots or 10 days in advance; Regular $239 afterward. Please only RSVP here after you have purchased the ticket.

Trip includes: 1 hour of hot air balloon ride, round trip transportation from NYC, champagne toast and a photo keepsake suitable for home or office.

Buy Ticket Here: http://oct2015hotairballoon.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is not confirmed until your payment is received.


Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $20 processing fee if cancelled 2 weeks in advance;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, you can transfer your spot to other with $20 transfer fee.

Official Site: http://www.abovethecloudsinc.com/

Hot air balloon video
https://youtu.be/E02fojV5Vm8

https://youtu.be/E02fojV5Vm8

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.
results.name: Sunrise Hot Air Balloon + Transport (New Date: 10/31)

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
Hi Photogs!

Every year, Craig graciously volunteers photography services for the HoBOOken 5K Halloween race! This is a fundraising event, with proceeds going to benefit the Hoboken Shelter. 

Craig needs volunteers from students and alumni to help photography the event! In this workshop, you will get tips on how to photograph a fast-motion event for editorial purposes, and receive a specific assignment to ensure we cover all aspects of the race! 

To participate in this workshop, we are asking for a $50 donation to the event. Our goal is to raise $1,000 this year! 

----------------------------------------

If you're not familiar with this event, it's an annual race along the Hoboken waterfront – and the runners are dressed in Halloween costumes! It's a great photo opportunity. After the 5K race, there is a "Scary Scurry" Kids' Race that is ran on the lawn on Pier A. More info about these races can be found at HoBOOken5k.com

Proceeds from the race go to benefit the Hoboken Homeless Shelter. 


----------------------------------------


To secure a spot, please make your $50 (or more!) donation here. When you receive your confirmation email, simply forward to Craig at [masked].
results.name: Photograph the HoBOOken 5K Race!

results.description:
Our 30-day challenge has officially begun! If you're new to the group, feel free to join in :)

Attached here you'll find the workout calendar and exercise routines for this month!


Why:

The purpose of doing this challenge together is to​ ​encourage each other and hold one another accountable. It's not meant to be a competition but rather ​motivation​ ​for you ​to stay consistent.


What:

Exercise series (attached here) that combines ​3 days of total body (abs, arms, legs, and derriere) resistance/toning workouts and 2 days of cardio per week​. ​You can obviously modify your rest days. ​I've attached a ​printable calendar so you check off each day you complete and stay motivated to power through the entire month! 

​On the cardio days you can do the cardio of your choice. I'll be switching up running with this tabata routine and this running HIIT routine. ​

Take 2 progress photos at the beginning and end of the month (front & side). Obviously you don't have to share them with the group but definitely take them for your own records​ and motivation​. 


When: Monday, ​October 5 - ​Saturday, ​October 31st. We'll celebrate our progress at the end of the month!


Where: Your home/gym/park. 


Download the calendar and exercise routines for this month here: http://www.meetup.com/Black-Female-Health-Fitness-Friends/files/


RSVP if you want to participate in the challenge! 

Share photos of your workouts or progress with the group by emailing [masked] or posting to our facebook group!


Health and happiness,

Mbali

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.
results.how_to_find_us: Google these coordinates: 40.6993163, -73.9982629

results.description:
Great Manhattan Bridge Walk.  Start at GW Bridge, end at Brooklyn Bridge. We will walk for about 12 hours and cross all of the bridges that we can walk over from Manhattan Island. There are 17, including the recently reopened Highbridge (aka Old Croton Aqueduct Bridge)!  The entire route will be 30+ miles of walking, plus 1-3 bus/subway rides. Bring water, sandwiches, snacks, and Metro Card. Moderately paced, plus there may be a “fast group” for those who want to walk faster and farther.

MEET: 8:45AM at Ft Washington Ave and 179th St, outside the GW Bridge Bus Station. (By subway, take A train to175th St, or 1 train to 181st St). Heavy rain at start cancels.

LEADER: Walt Wright. Phone:[masked]; email: [masked].

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join. If you are not a paid Shorewalkers member, please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike.
results.name: The Great Manhattan Bridge Walk

results.description:
"We’re living at a transformative moment of history when humanity is faced with a critical choice: either we continue to flow with the currents of greed and ignorance and risk devastating the earth, or we adopt a scheme of values that gives pride of place to compassion, care, and social justice.

-Ven. Bhikkhu Bodhi, BGR Founder and Chairperson"


We will be attending the annual Buddhist Global Relief Walk to Feed the Hungry. There will be many other Buddhist groups and individuals of all backgrounds also attending. We highly encourage you to support in any way you can.

The walk starts at 9:00 am at Riverside Park in Manhattan at 79th Street (North Lawn), up to 119th Street inside the park, down Riverside Drive to 82nd Street, and ends at Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church at 213 West 82nd Street in Manhattan

You can find more information about the walk (including how to donate) here and more info about Buddhist Global Relief here.

We hope to see you there!

WALK TALK YOGA


PRENATAL WALKING & YOGA GROUP IN BROOKLYN, PROSPECT PARK

Join prenatal yoga instructor Sofia and birth doula Kyra for a weekly walk through Prospect Park with a thirty minutes prenatal yoga class at the end of the walk.

The walking moms at 9AM at the entrance of the Brooklyn Public Library. We will start our walk at 9:15AM, which will take around 45 minutes, followed by a 30 minute prenatal yoga session.

This is a great way to start the day, bring new mommies together, stay fit and most importantly prepare for the special moment - the birth of your baby (Partners and future moms are welcome to join as well.)

Registration & Cost: Simply e-mail Kyra and Sofia @ [masked]

results.description: Not suitable for Beginners, slow, hiker, runners, and dogs are not allowed. Let’s celebrate Halloween, and the last long hiking day before spring by doing a fun hilly demanding 10 mile hike up Bear, West, Timp, and Bald Mountains. We will meet at the Manitou train station at 9:00, and then shuttle over to the parking lot on 9W near the Cornell trail. We will start the hike by hiking up the Cornel trail to the 77 tail, and then take the Major Welch trail up Bear Mountain, and then take the AT down Bear Mountain, and up West. On West Mountain we will then take the TT down West, and up the Timp. We will then take the Rd down the Timp, and up the backside of Bald Mountain. We will then take the C trail back to the cars. The hike will be about 10 miles with four good climbs, and will be a fun friendly, but demanding hike with a reasonable number of stops. Leader determines the pace, route, number of stops and duration of stops. If you want to run do not come. If you want to stroll chose another hike. This hike is not easy, and involves 3100 feet of elevation gain. No swimming. Bring at least 3 quarts of water your lunch and wear hiking boots. Rain Cancels. Trans. 5B, but take the Early Metro North Train that leaves 7:48 and arrives 8:58. Exit the train between the last two cars. (Check with Metro North because they are doing construction and the schedule might change). Drivers park at the end of Manitou road which is located 1 ¼ miles of Bear Mountain Bridge on Manitou Road off 9D. L: Joe Nigro[masked] (7:30-9:30 PM) [masked]
results.name: 10 Mile Bear, West, Timp and Bald Mountains Hike.

results.description:
Dear Dharma Friends,

Please join us on the 2015 NYC Walk to Feed the Hungry organized by Buddhist Global Relief ("BGR").  

BGR was formed by American Buddhist scholar-monk, Ven. Bhikkhu Bodhi, and his students in 2007 to help the needy. 

We will meet at the corner of 79th Street and Riverside, look for the our organizer Peter Sarfaty.

The walk will start from the registration area up to 119th Street inside the park.  Walk will return by sidewalk outside the park and down Riverside Drive to 82nd Street.  Then we will end the walk at the lunch venue, Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church, located at 213 West  82nd Street in Manhattan.

Last year we had a great time, meeting other compassionate Buddhists, like minded friends, and monastics from many different sanghas.  Please join us for a great cause if you can.

Three ways to join us!

(1) Join us for the walk or donation.<http://www.firstgiving.com/team/304071>

(2) Join on your own walk or donations.   <http://www.firstgiving.com/BuddhistGlobalRelief/2015-new-york-walk-to-feed-the-hungry>

(3) Just spread the word <http://www.buddhistglobalrelief.org/> 

Thank you,

Eddie

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
PLEASE BE AWARE OF THE WAIT LIST FOR THIS EVENT AND ADJUST YOUR RSVP IF YOU HAVE A CHANGE OF PLANS. ALSO, PLEASE REVIEW THE NO SHOW POLICY BELOW. THANK YOU FOR YOUR UNDERSTANDING.

No Show Policy:
Our policy for meet up members (not club members that have paid their yearly dues) is if you did not change your RSVP to a no ONE DAY before the event it will be noted on your attendance. A third offense of not changing your RSVP to a no will result in that meetup members removal from the meetup group. 

                                                                                                                                         Leader: Pat Horsch, cell day of hike[masked]

Meet: 10 AM at Trailside Nature Center parking lot on Coles Ave.
We will do a 4- to 5-mile hike on leader’s choice of trails, approx. 2 hours. “Spirited” hikers are encouraged to dress for the occasion if desired, as long as the costume does not interfere with their ability to hike safely (no Barney costumes). Less spirited souls may dress as usual but may not get a treat. Easy to moderate terrain. Boots recommended, bring water. Steady rain cancels. Watch this site on the morning of October 31 for any last minute changes/cancellations.
DIRECTIONS:
Trailside Nature Center, Coordinates: N40° 40.97', W74° 22.38'
1.1. FROM LIVINGSTON: Take John F. Kennedy Parkway past the Short Hills Mall keep left, following signs
to SUMMIT and River Rd. Proceed 0.5 miles at light by Novartis, turn left onto Morris Ave. Continue 1.9 miles past Overlook Hospital as road bends to left. After passing the hospital, take the first right onto Glenside Ave. then in 0.1 miles bear left onto Baltusrol Rd (signs says US 22) road name changes to Summit Rd. After 1.1 miles, at light, turn right onto Summit Lane. At traffic circle, take the second right and proceed 0.5 miles further to a right turn onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.
1.2. ALTERNATIVE: VIA US ROUTE 22: Take Mountainside/New Providence Rd. exit (turn right from westbound lanes; jug-handle from eastbound lanes). Proceed uphill northwest bound for 0.7 miles (name changes to Deer Path) to the 5th right onto Ackerman Ave. In 0.4 miles at Tee intersection, turn right onto Coles Ave. Proceed 0.2 miles to Trailside Nature & Science Center parking lot on the left.
1.3. ALTERNATIVE: VIA I-78 EAST: Take Exit 44 (New Providence/Berkeley Heights). At light turn left onto Glenside Ave. Go 1.3 miles and turn right into the Watchung Reservation (CR 645 - W.R. Tracey Dr). Proceed past Lake Surprise, uphill and straight past loop picnic area. Bear left and continue 1.3 miles to traffic circle. At traffic circle take the first right and proceed 0.5 mile on Summit Lane. Turn right onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.

If this is your third meetup event with TSR we kindly ask that you join the club for $15 yearly membership with full access to our schedule which allows you to attend hikes and other outings 6 days a week. As a dues paying member of TSR you do not need to sign up for events and you do not have to be entered onto a waiting list. You can attend all events. Visit our website at tsr.nynjtc.org for an application and schedule preview.
