results.description:
Event space and refreshments sponsored by:  Viacom

Event agenda:

10:00am - 12:00pm:  Workshop

12:00pm - 1:00pm:  Lunch will be provided

1:00pm - 3:00pm:  Workshop

Description:

In this workshop, you will learn and apply the basics of building a modern, “full-stack” web application using Python and Django.  Python is a programming language with rich data analysis libraries including pandas, scipy and scikit-learn, and Django (written in Python) is the web framework behind Instagram and Pinterest.  Attendees will learn how free, open-source technology can create end-to-end machine learning applications.  We will build an application that allows users to query data from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), perform linear regression, and present the results in a web-based chart.  

For data scientists, an understanding of Django permits their audience to choose input parameters,  integrate the parameters into their algorithms and present them visually, all within Python.  

Skills Covered:

Python pre-processing, putting data into a database, API call, application deployment on Pythonanywhere, retrieving / graphing in HTML page


Prerequisites / Preparation:

• some experience in linear regression

• some experience with python (python does not have to be loaded on laptop)

• create GitHub account

• create pythonanywhere account

• Google Chrome browser should be on laptop

Instructor Bio:

Geoffrey Sechter is an entrepreneur solving problems by asking the right questions and developing full-stack web applications (mostly) using Python and Django. In New York City since a failed Seattle-based startup in 2013, Geoffrey helps organize the 2000+ member Django NYC meetup groupand supports the global Django Girlsorganization. When the entrepreneur hat comes off, Geoffrey bikes, meditates, cooks, swing dances and hikes, plus other stuff you'll have to ask him about sometime.  His twitter:  @gsechter
results.name: Hands-on Introduction to Django

Building a roadmap for your novel"

There's nothing more terrifying than a blank page, but an outline can help guide your writing from start to finish. 

Come with your general plot and characters, and we'll help you workshop it into chapter-by-chapter plan. 

You'll enter National Novel Writing Month prepared!

https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/uvKDCvgqUdu8NUi25RG5U8aBCK94395hiOAJPjVGwzSEvjJ5uGUovZEYWIYgkirseHNQ8ZYevQiKDj1AMVro86T25AyFAzlSlfL-VoGDiSwcMULmVENrUhxhtq8ASwAhVQ=s1600

Mary Fan is a sci-fi/fantasy writer hailing from Jersey City, NJ. She is the author of the Jane Colt sci-fi series, published by Red Adept Publishing. Her young adult dystopian fantasy series, Flynn Nightsider, is currently under contract with Glass House Press. And her young adult fairytale series, Fated Stars, is also under contract with Glass House Press.

In addition, Mary is the co-editor of Brave New Girls: Tales of Girls and Gadgets, a young adult sci-fi anthology about brainy heroines.

results.description:
The annual HoBOOKen 5K Race is scheduled for Saturday, October 31st (that's right - it falls right on Halloween this year!)


This race is limited to 1,500 runners and sells out each year – so be sure to register early to ensure your spot.

About the Race

This 5K race is a flat and fast race. Our USATF certified race course (NJ13569JHP) will follow along Hoboken’s beautiful waterfront and finish on Pier A. Runners at all levels are invited to participate and encouraged to wear Halloween costumes!

The registration fee is $35 (with proceeds benefiting the Hoboken Homeless Shelter). You can register here.

Team Options

To run as a team, you need a minimum of 3 people—and there is no maximum. You can register in the following categories: Open, Men, Women. Teams can also participate in a fundraising contest to win additional prizes (TBD).

Race Day Schedule

8:00 AM – 9:45 AM Packet Pickup @ Pier A
9:45 AM – Race Announcements
10:00 AM - HoBOOken 5K Race (adults)
11:00 AM Scary Scurry Race (for kids)
11:15 AM Costume & Race Awards

After the Race


The fun doesn’t have to stop after the race! Join your fellow runners at Wicked Wolf Tavern (across from Pier A) for an after-party. Need more incentive? When you present your race bib, Wicked Wolf will donate 10% of your check back to the Hoboken Shelter!

Visit HoBOOken5K.com for more information
results.name: HoBooken 5K Halloween Run!

results.description:
LEADER: Jeffrey Sovelove ([masked])

RATING: B 8 B+

Meet at the Visitors’ Center at 10 AM sharp. We’ll climb to the Sterling Forest Fire Tower then hike the Sterling Ridge and Bare Rock Trails to the Bare Rock Vista for lunch. After lunch, we’ll return to the Visitors’ Center back down the Bare Rock Trail. See the Sterling Forest web site for information and directions: http://nysparks.state.ny.us/parks/74/details.aspx. Inclement weather cancels. Joint ADK/Sierra Club hike. TC Sterling Forest map 100.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:

In Kundalini Yoga we harness the mental, physical, and nervous energies of the body and put them under the domain of the will, which is the instrument of the soul. This technology precisely and consciously combines breath, mudra, eye-focus, mantra, body locks, and postures to balance the glandular system, strengthen the nervous system, expand lung capacity, and purify the blood. "In Kundalini Yoga the most important thing is your experience. It goes right to your heart. No words can replace your experience. Your mind may accept the words or it may not, but your consciousness will not accept just words."  
-Yogi Bhajan, The Aquarian Teacher Training manual, p. 20

Spectacular fall colors--Last Dance Walk of October! Bring your own ipod & earbuds. We dance walk around the park loop. What is dance walking? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. results.description:
Walking Tour Hudson Heights and Inwood: Celebrating Autumn (and hopefully some fall color)!  Note repeating last year's adventure... 

Hudson Heights and Inwood are two of Manhattan's loveliest neighborhoods.  Fort Tryon Park features the beautiful heather gardens (pictured below), panoramic views of the Hudson River, and The Cloisters, the medieval branch of the Metropolitan Museum of art. The building itself is amazing: an assemblage of 13th century French cathedrals so get ready for a step back in time!  Note we may have a  optional brief visit to The Cloisters.

Inwood Park features rugged, almost primeval terrain, caves and rock shelters once used by American Indians, and the last remaining salt marsh on Manhattan.  Along the way, we’ll stop and marvel at the George Washington Bridge, learning about its history along with the evolution of these uptown Manhattan neighborhoods. We'll pass by the last remaining farmhouse in Manhattan, the shrine of Mother Cabrini (patron saint of the immigrants), and battle sites from the American Revolution.   Along with some fascinating geology, there are also some interesting housing developments, one of which includes the remains of a former castle and the Tudor-style Hudson View Gardens.

Note this is a long walk with some uphill climbing in Inwood Park.  I strongly suggest bringing a picnic lunch and water to drink.  We will also pass by several take out restaurants. Total walking distance is around 4 miles.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the A Train to 181st Street, exit front of train (coming from downtown) and take the elevator up to Fort Washington Avenue.   Entrance to Bennett Park is across the Street along Fort Washington Avenue.  We will gather there.

results.description:
A HAPPY  HALLOWEEN HIKE WALKING THRU THE SLEPPY HOLLOW CEMETERY IN SLEEPY HOLLOW, FINAL HOME OF WASHINGTON IRVING, ANDREW CARNEGIE AND MANY MORE.


WE WILL HAVE A ONE HOUR GUIDED TOUR OF THE HISTORIC CEMETARY FOR A COST OF $ 12.00 PER PERSON, 30 person limit 

costume and clothing optional

A fast paced Hike from PHILIPSE MANOR  TRAIN STATION to Hasting on Hudson, by walking SLEEPY HOLLOW CEMETARY,the Old Croton Aqueduct (OCA) and the Westchester River Walk, approximately 10/12 miles on gravel/paved trails and streets, mostly flat with some hills to and from train stations. Walk through SLEPPY HOLLOW CEMETERY , LYNDHURST CASTLE , Dobbs ferry, Ardsley on Hudson, Mercy college and Irvington on Hudson  ENDING  AT A GREAT OUT DOOR BAR/RESTURANT IN HASTING ON HUDSON. with a return back to PHILIPSE MANOR by train for drivers, or back to NYC. (Sr. Fare $1.50).( off peak w metro card $5:50) Drop outs in evry town.

DROP OUTS IN EVERY TOWN AND WE WILL PROBALY FINISH 4 / 5 ish

The OCA was built in 1842 and is  41 miles long and at one time brought water from the Croton reservoir to NYC.

 Drivers can park free at the PHILIPSE MANOR train station. Updated Train schedule and fares from the city will be posted a few weeks before the hike.  TO return back to NYC THERE IS A TRAIN EVERY 23 MINUTES AFTER THE HOUR.

And We will also walk thru the grounds of the photogenic  Lyndhurst castle.

Also Plenty of clean bathrooms along the way

 Train schedule from grand central to PHILIPSE MANOR THE  9:20 train arrives 10:15 , takes  55 minutes    REG FARE Off peak with metro card is $5.50 round trip. Senior fare is $1.50 from HASTINGS ON HUDSON back to PHILIPSE MANOR.

Bring lunch, snacks, water. We will have  lunch by a Hudson River Park, and a  great outdoor restaurant and bar with Hudson river views at trails end .  Non members $3.00.   Crazy weather cancels.

Leader: Rick Mohovich MEET HIKE LEADER AT PHILIPSE MANOR  TRAIN STATION ,TALL GUY WITH COWBOY HAT. Cell[masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for Shorewalkers members who have paid the $20 annual membership fee, $3 for non-members. Non-members please pay the hike leader at the beginning of the hike or visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: Happy Halloween Hike/Old Croton Aqueduct / WESTCHESTER River walk.

I'll be teaching a hands-on fermented veggies class on Saturday, October 31st at Brooklyn Brainery.  It's a perfect class for the newbie! Details below.  To ensure your spot, please be sure to register through the Brooklyn Brainery website.   Click here.


Best,

Angela Davis

NYC Ferments Co-organizer

Learn how to transform fresh vegetables through lacto-fermentation into probiotic goodness. The process of fermentation increases the nutritional value and vitamin content of vegetables through beneficial bacteria.

In this class, you'll learn how to make sauerkraut and other fermented veggies that will help boost your immune system and overall health.

results.description:
The Cloisters is one of the most extraordinary places in NYC...beautiful, quiet, spiritual.   I think it takes on a special charm at this cool and crisp time of year.

Let's look around!  There's something for everyone...art, architecture, stained glass, gardens, Unicorn Tapestries, photo ops...and let's share what we like!


A few notes:

- Suggested admission is $25, but you may pay what you wish.  The desk staff will accept any amount cheerfully.  Your admission tag is also valid at the Met's main (5th Ave) building today, if you want to go there yourself after the meetup.


- At this time of year, the seasonal cafe is closed

- To get there, take the A train to 190th St.  Ride the elevator upstairs and then turn right as you exit the station.  The Cloisters is 1 stop uptown on the M-4 bus, or else you can walk 1/2 mile through the lovely (but slightly confusing) Ft. Tryon Park.  If walking, take the pedestrian path, which is slightly left of the car path.


If something comes up and you can't attend, please change your RSVP status as soon as possible.  Given the small size of this meetup group, no-show's would be a big loss.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Do they have food?

Yes, there will be a cafe serving home-made cakes, fresh waffles, sausages, Leberkaes as well as hot and cold beverages.

Is it only for kids?

No, it is very kid & family friendly, but of course everyone is welcome.

How do I get there by subway?

C/E: 23rd Street - 1 Block

1: 23rd Street - 2 Blocks

F: 23rd Street - 3 Blocks

What about the Halloween Parade?

The Halloween parade does not start until 7pm, so there will be plenty of time after the event to either head a few blocks down to get a good spot or to escape the area before it starts.

Is there a cover charge?

No, it is free to anyone. There is food & beverages available for purchase

What/Who is CityKinder?

CityKinder is an online & offline community platform for German-speaking parents. They offer a wide range of events, groups, classes, and seminars for German-speaking families in the New York metro area.

They are also providing expecting parents and young families with comprehensive lists of resources that will help them navigate their new environment as well as parenthood.

For more info, please contact Gabi Hegan or one of her dedicated colleagues at [masked] or browse their website at www.citykinder.com

Can I contribute?

Any proceeds from this event will go towards St. Paul's German Church to support their community services. If you would like to donate books and gently used toys, please contact their office at [masked]

As always, please update your RSVP if your plans change as we are providing the organizer with our attendee list so they can plan accordingly. 

I will be at the event as a volunteer helper, looking forward to seeing you there!

Thomas

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
**A special Halloween shoot! Costumes encouraged!**


Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have a lot of people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.

Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

Club Hours: Gotham Archery has reserved space for us from 11:00am to 1:00pm. Those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer at the regular range rate.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at Gotham Archery, you will have to take a safety & intro lesson class from the range staff and demonstrate safe shooting. No exceptions. Please arrive 15 minutes early; the class will start promptly at 11:00am.

Public Transportation: Gotham Archery is located at 480 Baltic St (Brooklyn, NY 11217) in Gowanus. It's a few blocks south-west of the Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr train station. The 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, B, D, N, Q and R trains all stop there.

By car from LI:You can take the LIE, Northern State or Southern State to either Jackie Robinson or the BQE.  Set your GPS to 480 Baltic Street, NY, 11217.  The parking on Sat. AM isn't bad at all: you may have to circle the block once or twice.  The building is painted in a somber yellow ochre.

BUT: please consider car pooling or training it: the drive is awful; the train is lovely.  Most LI LIRR stations suspend parking fees on Sat and Sun.

You change at Jamaica and get in at the Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn-- walk south for about 7-8 minutes to Baltic -- go right.  Gotham is on the left.  The first time you walk here, you should have your GPS active.


 Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rate: $20 for two hours of shooting, $5 for equipment (plus sales tax). These discounts only apply during official club hours.

 Club Equipment: At this time we cannot guarantee there will be club equipment to borrow, so please plan accordingly. One of us will post in the comments if that changes.

 See you on the shooting line!

results.description:
Since it is Halloween, we decided to go to a hike that will have abandoned structures and ruins.  It will be an intermediate level hike in Palisades Interstate Park (Alpine, NJ) on Sat, Oct 31. The hike is 5 miles. Dogs are allowed. The hike goes by splendid river vistas and passes the remains of old estates, the most well known of which is the "Cliff Dale" estate of George Zabriskie, built in 1911.  There will be outstanding views over the Hudson River.  We will be on a trail that was used by British troops in 1776 during the American Revolution (although the historical truth can be debated based on the signs that are next to each other with conflicting information).


For those coming, I suggest wearing layers of long sleeve shirts if it will be cold. Also, it's recommended to bring a backpack, 2 liters of water, chapstick, gloves, and a small trail sandwich.

We'll meet at 11 AM at the parking lot of the Palisades Interstate Park Administration Building. Driving directions are below. I estimate the hike will take three hours and will have an extra half hour break for lunch and an extra half hour for ruin exploration.

My cell phone number is[masked]

General Driving Directions:

Take the Palisades Interstate Parkway to Exit 2 (Alpine) and follow signs to the Police Headquarters. Park in the parking lot for the Administration Building.

Driving Directions from the Tappan Zee Bridge:

After you cross the Tappan Zee Bridge, take 287 West / 87 North to Exit 10 to merge onto US-9W South / Hillside Avenue.  Take that for 7 miles and then turn left onto the Palisades Interstate Parkway South ramp.  Take the Palisades Interstate Parkway South for 2.5 miles to Exit 2.  Take Exit 2 and then turn right onto US-9W North.  Take the first right onto Alpine Approach Road and go under the Palisades Interstate Parkway.  Stay to the right, following the sign towards the Police Headquarters and the Boat Basin Picnic Area.  In approximately 0.1 miles, you will turn right into the Parking Lot for the Administration Building (the first parking lot on your right).

Driving Directions from the George Washington Bridge:

After you cross the George Washington Bridge, take exit 73-74 for US-9W toward NJ-67 / Fort Lee / Palisades Parkway.  Use the right lane at the fork to stay right and follow signs for US 9W North / Palisades Parkway.  Turn right onto US-9W North / Fletcher Avenue, following signs for Palisades Interstate Parkway.  Keep right, following signs for Palisades Interstate Parkway.  Continue onto Palisades Interstate Parkway North.  Take Exit 2 toward Alpine / Closter / Route 9W.  Stay straight, following the signs for the Police Headquarters and Boat Basin Picnic Area.  In approximately 0.1 miles, you will turn right into the Parking Lot for the Administration Building (the first parking lot on your right).
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in a Blue PT Cruiser in the Parking Lot
results.name: Palisades Interstate Park Estate and Manor Ruins and Amazing Views Moderate Hike

results.description:
Generosity (Giving)

"The Buddha said that no true spiritual life is possible without a generous heart. . . . Generosity allies itself with an inner feeling of abundance — the feeling that we have enough to share." - Sharon Salzberg 

The Ten Perfections are important mind/body qualities or strengths that we can cultivate in any life situation and on the cushion.  When we make these Perfections our priority in life, they support us on our journey toward awake awareness.      


The Ten Perfections or qualities of mind are:

Generosity (Giving)
Virtue (Morality/Ethics)
Renunciation (Letting go of obstacles to awakening)
Wisdom (Discernment)
Energy (Effort)
Patience (Endurance)
Truthfulness
Determination/Resolution
Loving Kindness/Goodwill
Equanimity (Impartiality and balance)

The brief topic discussion will be followed by a guided meditation and time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. I hope you'll join us.


Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.
results.name: The Ten Perfections - Generosity

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Ensemble class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

More details here: www.PlayWithDewey.com

Anyone and everyone is welcome!

(We prefer that you sign up online, so we can get an accurate head count. If you can only pay in-person, please bring exact change.)

-----------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show called "The Lady Winifred and Didi Show."
results.name: Basic Improv for Public Speaking

See GORUCK Website: http://www.goruck.com/ for more details on different distances, events and dates. We will have free optional group trainings (all members of this meetup can attend the trainings) to prepare for the event. Starting Point: Somewhere in Manhattan, to be announced at least one week before the event date. GORUCK LIGHT details:

Event duration 4-5 HOURS, event distance 7-10 MILES
Light = Fun on a team. Average completion rate: 100%.

Maybe you’re still not sure about GORUCK yet (what exactly is this, again?) but you want to do something because everyone tells you how great the people are and that it’s worth it. They’re right by the way and welcome to GORUCK Light. It means lighter vibe, lighter loads and less time commitment, which means more time to party with your class after you’re done.

Fun fact: never sign up and you’ll never know. But the average completion rate of those who show up is 100%. If you can do a 5K, you can earn the GORUCK Light patch.

WEIGHT REQUIREMENT
The weight in your rucksack aka backpack makes it rucking. The amount you carry is based on your weight:
Under 150 lbs. - 2 wrapped bricks or 10 lb. Filler Bag
150 lbs. and Over - 4 wrapped bricks or 20 lb. Filler Bag

results.description:
As a group, we study a text--a story, poem, or essay, in English, Spanish or Latin--then each child, with your help, writes something inspired by the text. After that, the kids take turns reading their writings out loud while everybody listens in a sacred hush. The simple grace of this ritual changes lives. The kids we work with are the children of Spanish-speaking immigrants living in poverty.

We have welcomed many brilliant authors who provide the texts we study from their writings. To read their testimonials, please see: www.stillwatersinastorm.org/testimonials/. For a quick introduction to Still Waters, including video by CBS Evening News and press from The Huffington Post and The Guardian, please go to: www.stillwatersinastorm.org/about/. 


Feel free to bring a friend! 
Muchas gracias! 
Gratias maximas! 
Many thanks!

results.description:
We'll start at the Museum of the City of New York, featuring exhibitions of the exhilarating folk-music scene in Greenwich Village in the 1950s and 60s;  powerful photographs of NYC slum and tenement life in the late 1800s; jewelry and costumes from the Gilded Age; a wonderful 22-minute film of NYC history; and much more. Next we'll visit the nearby Conservatory Gardens in Central Park, where we'll see a huge, glorious display of Korean chrysanthemums blooming at this freakishly late time of year. After lunch (see below), we'll view another vivid color display: the fall foliage peaking on the trees around the Meer (lake) and woods in the park's north end plus the woodsy Ramble and the main lake. Finally we'll return to the Museo del Barrio, next to the NYC Museum (two for the price of one, which is pay what you wish). The Museo has several striking exhibitions of contemporary Hispanic artists. 

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED:

DISTANCE: About 3-4 miles.


PACE: MODERATE (2.5 MPH), NOT SLOW. PLEASE, IF YOU WANT TO WALK SLOWLY, THIS IS NOT THE RIGHT EVENT FOR YOU.  

ENDING TIME: About 5 PM, though you can leave earlier, of course.


LUNCH: Bring your own. We'll eat in the park, starting around 2:15 PM. Please dress warmly enough to sit outside for half an hour or so.

COST: Pay what you wish at the NYC museum, plus $2 for me, in part to cover meetup's organizer fee. The Hispanic museum is free with admission to the NYC museum. 

TRANSPORTATION: Number 6 train to 103rd St. and Lexington Ave., then walk west to 5th Ave. 

WAITING LIST:

 Sign up and be patient, no matter how many are waiting. The waiting list will shrink because of cancellations, especially at the last minute. And remember: you can come if you're in the top 20 on the list (shown below the main list on the right side of this page on a computer--not an app or mobile device) at any time before the walk starts. By a day or two before, as the list shrinks, I usually confirm everyone who's still waiting. As a courtesy to others seeking a spot, please do not sign up unless you intend to go, rather than just as a placeholder in case nothing better turns up.

results.description:
Many members have been asking for our Saturday Figure Drawing Session.

Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of The Flatiron District.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.) 

• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.   

• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels.  

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

Our amazing space!

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Greetings everyone, I'd like to announce something that we've never done before: a very special Werewolf in the Park on HALLOWEEN! First of all, thank you to all who attended our past "Werewolf In the Park" events, they've been great! For everyone else, it's never to late to get in on the fun -come one, come all, and tell your friends as well.

On Saturday, October 31 (Halloween Day), we'll be returning to the event that is not unfamiliar to some of our members: Ultimate Werewolf in Fort Tryon Park. Ultimate Werewolf is a social game in which players are randomly assigned to one of two (or possibly more) teams: the villagers or the werewolves. The villagers must deduce who the werewolves are over a series of rounds using various techniques and social intrigue; this must be done before the werewolves are able to eliminate the villagers. For those of you who are unfamiliar with Ultimate Werewolf, check out Tom Vasel's review at:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kr1ZyYycUdQ

Ultimate Werewolf is the perfect game to play in an outdoor setting; just bring a folding chair or a picnic blanket and you're ready to go! All you need is the game (which I will supply) and the willingness to communicate with others. Since we'll be hosting this on Halloween day, feel free to wear your best Halloween costume! It's hard to tell what the weather will be like since we're posting this ahead of the date, but if the weather does not cooperate, we will try to find an alternate location or date. Also, if you do not know how to play Ultimate Werewolf, never fear, it is quite simple and several of us will be able to teach it to you within minutes; don't let that hold you back! We'll be meeting in Fort Tryon park, just north of Linden Terrace. Follow this link for a map:

Fort Tryon Map

We will be in the area indicated by the "meeple". Fort Tryon Park's entrance is located on the elevated street level at the 190th street station on the A-train. We hope to see you there! Message me if you need more information. Beginners and experts welcome; even if you're not sure if you want to play, stop by to observe and introduce yourself!

So bring along some tasty cider and donuts, or your favorite Halloween candy, and bundle up; let's get ready for our first (annual?) Halloween Edition of Werewolf in Fort Tryon Park!
results.name: A Very Special (Halloween) Werewolf in the Park!

Come and help us prepare our 13 planting beds for the fall.  We'll be stripping out summer plants such as tomatoes and peppers, spreading compost, planting fall seedlings and sowing cover crop seeds.  A hearty vegan soup provided!  Bring your own sandwich and beverage if you like.

Get a tour of the Imani Gardens I and II.  See our chicken coop, aquaponics project, orchard, water storage system, greenhouse and cob oven.  One of the most complete urban permaculture sites in New York!

The Imani Gardens are located in Crown Heights Brooklyn.  To get there you can take the 3,4,A,C trains to Utica.  Walk toward Pacific Street, then walk west.  Imani II is on the corner of Pacific and Schenectady.

results.description:
Hi everyone!


Please join us on our  excursion to the Cooper Hewitt Museum and have some fun exploring the coolest and most interactive museum in New York. Let's get to know each other and have a relaxing Saturday together :-)


We will meet right outside of the museum at 1 pm and will explore the current exhibits together. I am personally really excited to check out the "Pixar: The Design of Story" which is a  capsule installation of the collaborative design process behind Pixar Animation Studios now on view in the Process Lab. Rarely-seen hand-drawn sketches, paintings, and sculptures from over 25 Pixar films, plus hands-on design activities show how Pixar develops its popular characters, fosters emotional connections to its films, and, ultimately, places the design process at the studio’s creative core.

Looking forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Visiting Cooper Hewitt

This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

results.description:
Note: If you are planning on attending this meetup please RSVP. I want to be able to know how many people are coming for a given session. Thank you.

I often see members of this group looking for time to study English, so I would like to give the non-native English speakers in our group an opportunity to improve their English just like they have given us the chance to improve our Chinese, Japanese, or Korean skills.

I also hope that by extending this opportunity, we will encourage more native speakers of Chinese, Japanese, and Korean to participate and aid our CJK practice on Wednesdays.

Our practice will include games, discussion, and reading activities. Please look for a notice from me about what activities we will doing each Saturday.

Any and all suggestions for methods, activities, etc. are welcome.

This group was created to function as an exchange. We help you and you help us.

For native speakers of Chinese, Japanese, or Korean, we hope that you will attend our meeting on Wednesday to help our language learners.

Finally, for any native English speakers who are interested in helping, please contact me (Carl) if you want to help out. Please contact me so that we can meet on Wednesday and potential volunteer opportunities. We want to create a friendly and engaging atmosphere but I would like to talk with you for a brief moment during the week before you participate as a volunteer. 

If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, feel free to contact me (Carl).

How to find us...

Go to 53rd street and Lexington Ave. The building is across the street from a CVS pharmacy on 53rd St, there are two main entrances. The top entrance in the picture is on 53rd St between Lexington avenue and 3rd avenue. The bottom entrance is on the corner of 53rd St and Lexington avenue. The building is called the Citigroup Center but the area where we sit is also called the Atrium Shops and Cafes. Which is located on the bottom floor: a big open area which has many round and square tables and chairs. The ZIP CODE is 10022. If you still have problems finding us look for a high rise glass building. Barnes and Nobles and 24 Hr Fitness are also located in the same building except on the upper level. If you enter on the upper levels then take the escalator down to ground floor where all the people and tables are.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a printed or written meetup sign with our group name

results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!

If anyone is interested in attending the Halloween parade after our shoot, we can walk over together after the shoot and march in the parade as a group, taking photos of the festivities.


Parade starts at 7:00. Line up begins at 6:30 at 6th Avenue & Canal Street. The theme this year is shine a light! It's being referred to as Hallelujah Halloween. Dr. King is quoted on the site:

"Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." Bring the light! Bring the love!﻿

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

10v10, 75min+ game. Arrive early to warm up, and be ready to start at 2:00pm.


ALL players need to bring a white and black t-shirt and  ball.


It's a large field and some players may need the option to sub. If you're a dedicated goalkeeper let us know - Intermediate level.


****************************************************************

DETAILS:

• Played in a friendly environment. Pass the ball have fun.

• No rough tackles or play. Players are expected to bring a positive attitude, no screaming at/or berating team mates.

•  BRING A BALL. If you hit a ball into the river, you'll need to replace it!  If there aren't any dedicated goalkeepers playing, we rotate in goal every 5 mins.

• No metal cleats. Only turf or molded cleats.

• If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow, and it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


Payment goes toward field permit, equipment and fees.

See you at the pitch!


Note: The is a 2/3 regulation size field with full size goals. Not suitable for beginner level or inexperienced players.

Will there be a yoga mat for me ? 

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket. Whatever is available.

Can I text or call the Organizer ?

Yes, if you have a question which is not answered in here, you can text or call him.

[masked] 

Oh, OK. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.

Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 
Besides emergency situations, members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group.

I'm not sure if i can make it on time. Can I come later ?

Short answer is NO.We encourage everyone to attend the classes which are free. All you need to do is come on time.  

What kind of yoga class this will be ?

It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. The Instructor will be helping with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Great, how am i going to get there ? where do you guys meet ? 

LOCATION PICTURES ARE HERE(where we meet and practice): 

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26108446/

Access the webinar here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email. 


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>) 


----------------------------------------------------------------

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-FREE Class-(Online Webinar)

results.name: Voice / Singing Class -- Sat afternoon time.

results.description:
We get together every other weekend and play jazz.

If you plan to join the group, the most important thing you can tell us is what instrument you play.

Bring a copy of The Real Book (sixth edition). Most of the songs we play are there. If you want to work on a song that's not in the book, bring lead sheets for everyone.

We'll be in one of the rooms at Music Makers, on the third floor. The address and directions are above.


I'll usually let everyone know by Wednesday which room we'll be in on Saturday.

The rooms cost $70 for all three hours. We divide the cost equally.
results.how_to_find_us: It's between 7th and 8th avenues. Near the 1,2,3, A,C,E, B, and other trains. It's on the third floor.
results.name: Play Jazz!

results.description:
Every Saturday from 3:00 to 4:00 PM - Advanced level

$15 from 2 to 3 people - $10 from 4 to 6 people

You need to register prior to coming.

This is an advanced meeting! You should be almost fluent. I'm here to propose a new subject of conversation every week, to manage the discussion and each other time of speech as well as to correct mistakes (if you allow me to do so).

Au plaisir de faire votre connaissance!

Ingrid

www.facebook.com/thefrenchieonc
results.name: 1h French Conversation - Advanced Level

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Anderson Park)

results.description:
Greetings Ladies!

So the thing is, Halloween is one of my absolute favorite holidays. And I was thinking, what could be more fun on Halloween than going out in costume with all of you fabulous people and drinking craft beers?

Because Manhattan is going to be insane on Halloween, our crawl will be in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

We'll be meeting at Kent Ale House at 3PM on Saturday the 31st. Kent Ale House is a relatively new craft beer bar on Kent Ave in Williamsburg. It's walkable from the L train Bedford Ave or the G train Nassau Ave stops. They boast 24 craft beers on tap and have happy hour every day from 3-7pm so I figured this will be a great place to start our crawl.

Other destinations may include:

- Berry Park (German beers and yummy eats)
- Skinny Dennis (a honky tonk bar with free peanuts and a great selection of cheap draft beer)
- Spuyten Duyvel (more bottles than you can count)
- Who knows where else!

Because it's a holiday, we're making an exception for this gathering: if you would like to bring your significant other or a guy friend, please feel free.

There's only one requirement for this meet-up: you and your guest(s) must come in COSTUME! :)

Because we'll be changing locations over the course of the day/evening, I'll give out my cell phone number beforehand, so that you can text me in the event that you can't find us.

Looking forward to celebrating Halloween with all of you!

<3
Janelle

PS: Here's some links to the bars mentioned above:

http://www.kentalehouse.com/#!beer-list/c1rke
http://berryparkbk.com/?page_id=19
http://www.skinnydennisbar.com/#!menu/c1i3p
http://spuytenduyvilnyc.com/generalinfo.htm
results.name: Halloween Costume Bar Crawl!

results.description:
Note: This class is at 3pm in STUDIO 604.

Learn to Juggle the easy way...OR


learn new tricks if you already know the basics!

Meetup members save $5 off the regular $15 admission when purchasing here in advance. Or $15 at the door.

Class includes:

• All equipment for class use.

• Learn to juggle in slow motion with scarves.

• Learn to juggle with balls.

• Learn new tricks & patterns if you know the basics.

• Practice tips & resources

• A super fun time!


CLASS IS ON 5TH FLOOR IN STUDIO 604 at 3pm

Check out more about the class in The New York Times & Time Out New York!
results.name: Learn to Juggle! (or get better)

results.description: Who wants a Halloween euchre? The parade goes down Sixth Avenue, near our usual haunt. This could be a good thing, or a bad thing, depending on your perspective.
results.name: Halloween Euchre

venue.address_2: In Front of PATH Station 2 blocks South of Church st
venue.name: Ground Zero

results.description:
Thanks to everyone who came to the street action @ Ground Zero last weekend.  We are at Ground Zero Saturdays  to inform the public about 9/11 Truth, globalization and the threats to our liberties. We have some flyers and cd's ...bring what you can...or just as you are!!!


The street action will begin around 3:00pm and end close to 630pm. This week's action will be followed by an important business meeting and/or continued action at locations TBD.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the info boards
results.name: Street action at Ground Zero

results.description:
Prepay here: 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LFFFF6RRJWEWW

=============================================

Though just twelve streets long and two avenues wide, West Chelsea is the premiere district for art galleries in New York City, with over 200. On this private tour we will visit up to 12, all located within a three to four block radius. Highlights will include exclusive talks by owners and staff, as well as meetings with artists that will give us greater insight into the exhibits.

The tour will be led by Savona Bailey-McClain, founder and executive director of the West Harlem Art Fund, an organization that promotes art and culture in parks and other open spaces across NYC, as well as galleries. She has been involved in numerous public art installations and was recently selected to join TINA, a new international network for contemporary art curators based in Italy.


IMPORTANT: 


- Prepay here: 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LFFFF6RRJWEWW

- If you tried to use the above link but had trouble with Paypal, an alternate payment link on Brown Paper Tickets will be emailed upon request. This will require an extra $1 charge to help cover the higher fees with this processor.

- On October 30 (one day before), the price will go up to $25 if the event has not sold out. Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

- RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

- Online payment deadline is 10:30am on the day of the tour.

- Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled). However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.

- If you are late or having trouble finding the group, call or text (917) 680-0656. This is not a smartphone, so posting comments or sending messages through the Meetup site will NOT work.

- Please remember to bring photo ID in case it is requested by security at some of the galleries.

- Feel free to bring your camera. Taking pictures is allowed.

- The tour will last approximately two hours. Afterward, we will go somewhere nearby for food and socializing if there is interest.

- People with extensive art backgrounds are welcome, as are novices.

- This event is exclusively for members of my meetup groups and their guests, plus special invitees. It is not open to the general public.


See you there! 

Milton & Savona


UPDATE: ONLINE PAYMENTS NOW CLOSED. PAYMENT ACCEPTED ON SITE ($25 PER PERSON, CASH ONLY)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=HG6TAACZR7RUN

=============================================

Though just twelve streets long and two avenues wide, West Chelsea is the premiere district for art galleries in New York City, with over 200. On this private tour we will visit up to 12, all located within a three to four block radius. Highlights will include exclusive talks by owners and staff, as well as meetings with artists that will give us greater insight into the exhibits.

The tour will be led by Savona Bailey-McClain, founder and executive director of the West Harlem Art Fund, an organization that promotes art and culture in parks and other open spaces across NYC, as well as galleries. She has been involved in numerous public art installations and was recently selected to join TINA, a new international network for contemporary art curators based in Italy.

- Prepay here: 

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=HG6TAACZR7RUN

- If you are late or having trouble finding the group, call or text (917) 680-0656.  This is not a smartphone, so posting comments or sending messages through the Meetup site will NOT work.

- Please remember to bring photo ID in case it is requested by security at some of the galleries.

- Feel free to bring your camera.  Taking pictures is allowed.

- The tour will last approximately two hours.  Afterward, we will go somewhere nearby for food and socializing if there is interest.

results.description:
This is a meetup to introduce the Palisades Park Meditation center and introduce the subtraction meditation method that we study.  It will be an explanation of our method and a dialogue to answer any questions that you may have.  It is not an actual meditation session but we hope to give you a basic understanding of our method.  We welcome anyone who would like to visit our center to come and join us at this meetup.  The Palisades Park Meditation center is a warm and restful place where everyone is welcome.  

For individuals who can not make this meetup you can feel free to make an appointment for a private introduction for $10.  We offer appointments 7 days a week depending upon the meditation schedule of our current members.  Our goal is to keep a comfortable, peaceful and bright environment for our members.  

The Palisades Park Meditation Center is a non-profit, 501 (c)(3),organization that offers guided meditation sessions 7 days a week.  We are open weekdays from 6am-10pm, Saturdays 10am-10pm and Sunday 10am-5pm.  We currently have over 30 members who pay monthly membership dues, which are donations used for the maintenance and operational costs of the center.  We offer one month, one year and two year membership plans.  We do not offer memberships on a session by session basis. Our membership fees are non-negotiable and entitle the member to unlimited guided meditation sessions for the duration of the membership.  The $10 cost for the meetup would be applied to any membership plan should an individual decide to become a member of Palisades Park Meditation.  For more information please visit our website at newjerseymeditation.org
results.how_to_find_us: Located on the second floor and across from Palisades Park Police Station
results.name: Palisades Park Meditation Introduction

Nearly departed, but back from THE GRAVE!


It's time once again for Nightmare Night NYC 2015!!

Rest (in peaces) assured, we're bringing the best and the baddest party physically possible to NYC this year!!!

For those of you who remember in years past, Bronies-NYC has set the bar for Nightmare Night parties and this year it's all coming together on HALLOWEEN NIGHT for the first time ever.

We've got a whole haunted firehouse to freak out in - some fresh musical blood for the GRAVEYARD BASH and of course all the stuff you love from our monthly meetups.

NIGHTMARE NIGHT NYC is SIMPLY NOT TO BE MISSED

Of course in order to summon the headless horse we'll need to engage in some of our famous rituals from years past.

The Schedule of Events:

3pm - Mingle, visit our vendors, play table,video games and Interactive The Story Of The Blanks and Featuring Kar Dead Roses Art Table and Post-It-O-Lantern crafting from a world beyond!

6pm - Pizza Arrives

7pm - The Costume Parade!

• YourEnigma - NuDisco & Funk 

• Serif - Trance / House 

• Kezz - SpookyHouse

• H01ty - Hardstyle 

• CyberianWinter - HARDSTYLE  

11pm - Go home scarily satiated for another year! See you at the next monthly!

Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

results.description:
On 10/24 our regular practice of meditation at 4pm.


On 10/31 An interactive introduction to using Tai chi to create a higher level of meditative “listening” both within the individual and with a partner.


We will use walking and stepping as a meditative exercise to create internal balance; yin yang meditative hand movements to create awareness of internal balance of energy and two person exercises to develop listening skills with respect to the internal energy of the other.


This form of listening can be incorporated into all aspects of life ranging from enhancing tefilla, interpersonal communication, sports, health, meditation and self-defense. Led by Joel Friedman,  MD, PhD, scientist (Professor, Albert Einstein College of Medicine), mystic, thirty year practitioner and teacher of tai chi and other Chinese internal martial arts.


All are welcome and there is no cost to attend. We look forward to seeing you. more information at: http://www.jmcmontclair.com

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

4:00 - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
4:15 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on.
4:30 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
5:30- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road. We are sitting at the table in the back.

SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time.

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Don't know where to begin, read this.

http://gaiateabrew.com/leonbell/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Mini-Guide-to-Writing.pdf
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.milkandhoneycafeny.com

results.description:
Hi everyone!

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up. Also, please bring a white t-shirt, a red t-shirt, lots of water and be ready to have fun!

We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map.


If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

No ball hogging

The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Field F in Central Park  can be accessed from west 97th street or east 97th street on either side Central Park. We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map

Directions: By train: From the West side take the B or C to 96th street stop. From the east side take the 6 train to 96th street stop St.

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee: Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring: A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. Please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for a future game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will receive an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has openned up:). Please RSVP as soon as you get that e-mail since everyone on the waiting list will get the same e-mail. The first person who RSVP's takes the spot! Also check our Calendar for other games

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Trail Details: We'll, run 8 miles in the creepiest place ever! We’ll pass the Sleepy Hollow Cemetery twice. These are mild trails, good for beginners, keep in mind though that you’ll be running in the dark. Can’t run 8 miles while in a costume? ...no worries only run 4. We’ll make sure that you get to back to cemetery in one piece.

Via pubic transit:Take the 3:48 pm Metro North Hudson Line from Grand Central to Tarrytown (arrives at 4:25 pm).

By Car: Put 1 Depot Plaza Tarrytown NY 10591 in your GPS or meet us at the trail head across from the Sleepy Hollow, High School (near Bedford and Webber).

Bag Drop/Etc: We walk from the station to JP Doyle’s to drop our bags off (about a half mile), then we hit the the trails. After our adventure we head back to JP Doyle's, grab our bags, some drinks and then look for trouble roaming the streets of Sleepy Hollow.

As always, we encourage all paces to join, no matter how fast or slow.
