results.description:
Welcome!

In honor of halloween, in place of a basketball we will be playing with a pumpkin. Let's see how this goes.

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget:


* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* To be eligible to play we ask that you sign an annual waiver, which can be found here.


* If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers a message. 

The Rules:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 

6. Usually each team has 1-2 subs. Subs should enter mid-game (one of the teams reaches 6 points) and should start the following game. Teams can regulate themselves but let's just make sure everyone plays!

See you on the court! B-)

***SPECIAL NOTES***

Please do not show up unannounced (without RSVP):

This gym is small and 22 is the maximum number of players we can realistically allow. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. If you do show up unannounced we will have to ask you to leave. 

Refund Policy:

A refund/credit is available if you change your RSVP at least 24 hours in advance OR, if you change your RSVP within 24 hours, as long as you post a comment on the event page and someone picks up your spot (BOTH are required).

Lastly...

Feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your fingernails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

The Afterparty: 

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later!

results.description:
Comedy/Magic Performance, 5 pm; 
Optional Singles Mixer included, 7 - 8:30 pm 

For those single New Yorkers who feel like they don’t have a ghost of a chance for a date this Halloween, this comedy/magic masquerade mixer offers great laughs, and an amazing magic show with a costume contest and stress-free singles mixer to follow. Couples will also enjoy the performance and the mixer. And you'll be out by 8:30, to fly off to your next party or event (like Lou's Halloween Party at the Croton Lounge! http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Social/events/224992972/

The show illustrates key points from the dating and relationships book, What "Women Really Want From Men: A Step-by-Step Dating Manual," with comedy and magic, in ways that will delight and entertain both men and women. The mixer afterwards will be co-facilitated with Dane Colon, leader of the New York Meetup, "No More Mr. Nice Guy," and will feature a costume contest, as well as innovative, fun ways to get to know others in a relaxed and safe atmosphere. 

Mixer participants will have name tags that identify whether they’re interested in dating – or not. 

Cost: $35 + 2 drink minimum paid at the theater. 
ENTER PROMO CODE 'MEETUP' FOR MEETUP MEMBERS ONLY TO GET A $5 DISCOUNT ON THE TICKET. 
For tickets, go to http://www.triadnyc.com/shows and scroll down to click on "What Women Really Want from Men" 

**************************************************************** 

MORE INFORMATION

Author Melanie Rubin teams up with career comedy magician and mentalist Max Krause to present an innovative comedy show of magic and mystery based on Rubin’s new book, "What Women Really Want from Men: A Step-by-Step Dating Manual." As we all know, love and relationships are both magical and mysterious, hopeless and hilarious. The book offers a road map for smart, available men who’d like to find and establish ongoing, satisfying relationships with women they enjoy and respect. Based on interviews with women around the U.S. and abroad, Rubin shares exactly what women want from men at each step in the dating process.

This debut performance in New York will illustrate key points from the book with comedy and magic. Though tasteful, the show is recommended for an adult audience.

For more information about the book, and the shows, visitwww.kpft.org/archive, choose “The Progressive Forum” for September 3, 2015, and drag the scroll bar to the halfway point to locate the interview, which begins 1 hour into the 2-hour show. 

Max Krause has performed all over the United States including New York City. To watch a video, visithttp://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g60933-d5995994-Reviews-Max_s_Magic_Theatre-Albuquerque_New_Mexico.html#REVIEWS

PRAISE FROM AUDIENCE MEMBERS at the six shows Rubin and Krause performed in New Mexico earlier this year: 

“We had a great time. It was like the Beatles’ ‘Magical Mystery Tour’ into a woman’s mind about dating!” – Tom 

"This M&M duo was absolutely delicious. It is so nice to be able to laugh at ourselves when pursuing something we take so seriously. Enlightening information with a lot of humor for flavor! – Mary

“I enjoyed the show. It was an entertaining way to present ideas from the book – and it felt very relaxed.” – Robert 

COMMENTS ON MELANIE RUBIN'S FACILITATION of groups with singles:

"Melanie is exceptionally gifted at facilitating this process and I highly recommend her events." – Alberto

"Melanie creates a safe, comfortable atmosphere for an emotionally-laden topic  – dating and relationships!" – Sandi

"If you are remotely curious, go to the event and stay open. It is definitely worth it!" – Peter

" Definitely do it. You will learn about yourself in a kind and gentle way and make more room for love in your life." – Charey

*********************************************************************

Cost: $35 + 2 drink minimum paid at the theater. 
ENTER PROMO CODE 'MEETUP' FOR MEETUP MEMBERS ONLY TO GET A $5 DISCOUNT ON THE TICKET. 
For tickets, go to http://www.triadnyc.com/shows and scroll down to click on "What Women Really Want from Men"

results.description:
We'll be sporting our best Bernie costumes and marching in one of the nation's biggest Halloween events! The 42nd Annual Village Halloween Parade is free and open for ANYONE to participate (you don't need to pre-register or sign up) with just one little caveat: you need to wear a costume! We'll be providing as many folks as possible with Bernie masks, but please come decked out as you please with your own white scraggly hair, wrinkled dress shirts, suits, and glasses! Also, be sure practice up on your Brooklyn accent and "Enough is Enough!" Bernie impression.

Because the parade doesn't start until 6:30pm, we're going to meet up at The Whiskey Tavern (79 Baxter Street) around 5pm to assemble, imbibe, and get comfortable morphing into our favorite guy.

If you don't want to partake in the happy hour, we'll be meeting promptly at 6:30pm on the corner of Canal and Broadway. Assembly and participation directions can be found here: https://www.halloween-nyc.com/participate.php

We'll want to bring flyers and other Bernie literature to hand out to the thousands of spectators. The parade will also be filmed live on NY1, so let's really make this a spectacle and go all out!

Please contact Paul [masked]) if you'd like to help with arranging materials, literature, or anything else. If you can, please rsvp at: https://go.berniesanders.com/page/event/detail/volunteeractivityflyeringcallingwalkingetc/4vmgl
results.how_to_find_us: B or Q to Canal.  Look for Bernie costumes!
results.name: NYC Halloween Parade: Dress and March Like Bernie!

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Looking for a gentler, more magical alternative to the candy fuelled trick-or-treating?  Or would like to fit in both?

This is an event for children and their families, an enchanted walk through a world of light and darkness, populated by sprites, fairies, kings, queens, and a menagerie of otherworldly beings.


We went last year for the first time and our boys were entranced by the silent fairy tale tableaus being acted out all around.  Rapunzel, Rumpletiltskin, Little Red Riding Hood to name but a few.

Come in your fancy dress and enjoy this wonderful family friendly event.  The earlier you arrive, the shorter the wait for your magical walk to begin.

Fee: Donations to support Helping Hands and People to People will be gratefully accepted.

Information: Email [masked]

results.description:
Café Centro- Halloween
200 Park Avenue @45th Street (Metlife)
Saturday, October 31st
6:00 pm optional drinks, 6:45 pm dinner
$83 3-course meal, glass wine, coffee, t&t.

It is Halloween night so join us for a not so scary French meal at this bustling French brasserie with a style that echoes the glamour of Paris in the 1930s. Guests can watch executive chef Ted Rozzi prepare French-inspired cuisine in the glass-enclosed display kitchen. A richly elegant Grand Café in the classic Parisian tradition - set in the iconic international style landmark MetLife Building - Café Centro offers a select menu of French favorites with a Mediterranean twist. Join us on Halloween as we celebrate with candies and costumes (optional).

11:30 - for us no party is complete without bollywood clubbing!! so we head to Lexicon! Oh and as its haloween make sure you dress is haloween themed ;)
results.name: play ping pong, have a few drinks, dinner followed by a bollywood night!

results.description:
We will be learning and exploring the Tensegrity Practices developed by Carlos Castaneda.  The practice is mainly focused on the Magical Passes – modernized forms of body movements which open us to our energetic core, giving us vitality and physical prowess, concentration and purpose, overall wellbeing of body, mind, emotions and spirit, and enhanced awareness.  

Open to all levels.  Please wear comfortable clothing and bring water.  No street shoes are allowed in the studio.

Suggested Donation: $8.00

Contact: [masked] or[masked]

Looking forward to practice with you.  

NYC Tensegrity Group
results.how_to_find_us: Please contact us at nyintent@gmail.com or call us at 917-498-1071
results.name: NYC Tensegrity Practice

results.description:
夜市“Night Market”是亚洲美食文化中的一块瑰宝。穿梭于拥挤的人流中，纷繁复杂的气味相互融合，各种吆喝声此起彼伏，嘴里手上满是各种美味，除了琳琅满目的小吃外还有不少游戏娱乐活动。这种似曾相识的感觉，你马上就可以在纽约找到啦！
皇后区国际夜市将于4月在Flushing Meadows Corona Park开幕，届时会有超过100家小商铺参与活动。这个夏日，纽约将充满了东方味道，来自亚洲各地的美味小吃、艺术品、文化活动等，都会让你感受到不一样的夏夜。

活动将从4月一直持续到10月，每周六将在 Corona Park的New York Hall of Science举行。如果您也想参与其中，售卖您自制的私房菜或家乡美食也可以报名成为商贩。

时间：每周六晚上6点——午夜 （2015年4月-10月）

地点：New York Hall of Science in Flushing Meadows Corona Park （皇后区可乐娜公园内）

活动的官方网址：http://queensnightmarket.com/
results.name: Queens Night Market 皇后区美食夜市

results.description:
Ok gouls and goblins it's that time of year again!  Let's don our best Halloween costumes  and go to the Halloween Parade with the other closeted freaks for an epic evening of tricks, treats, Instagramming, and Caitlyn Jenner sightings.

Like last year we'll meet at 4pm sharp at Barclays Center and take the train together to Union Square and walk over to 6th Ave towards the festivities. 

I'll post my number as we get closer to the event and update the details of the meetup as needed.
results.name: Halloween In NYC 2015!!

results.description:
BROTHERS AND SISTERS OF THE CRAFT.... May I invite you to this exciting Halloween Event.

ARTISTS CRAFTERS
MUSIC HENNA
PSYCHICS VINTAGE ANTIQUES
TAROT CARD READERS BEER
FOOD GIVEAWAYS-MORE Join Lady Morgana Avallone and Theresa the Charmed One, for a reunion of mediumship and psychic ability, tarot and spiritual counseling. Of course, we are mischief makers and you may get more entertainment than just a reading...cackles...but come into our parlor if you dare !
There will be spellworker bracelets, and magickal spellcasting kits, gifts and good cheer.. Don't be late !
I'll be waiting............ Lady Morgana Avallone

results.description:
Join a bunch of singles from multiple Meetup groups on Halloween. First we'll conduct a Date Walk to get to know each other and then we will take a gander upon the 42nd Annual Village Halloween Parade. Afterwards, those who are inclined can join the group for some tasty adult beverages. 

We will meet at 6 PM at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch and get to know each other for 30 minutes. Be advised that if you show up even 1 minute late you will miss us. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch</a> and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your <a href="http://www.meetup.com/DateWalking/">Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure you can call Beau at[masked] and he will wave you over to where the group is. 

Contest: 1 lady and 1 gent will win a 3-month subscription to Date Walking for the best costume (judged by the organizer). 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter
results.name: Halloween Singles Walk + Best Costume + Parade | Age 21 to 49

results.name: Halloween Parade

results.description:
When you lift the less than flattering connotational ties to "witch," that have evolved over time, what lies is the classic archetype of feminine power: the wild, wise, powerful woman, steady in her confidence and even stronger with her tribe. She is unafraid to face and embrace the dark side of her moon. She is perceptive, alluring, and influential. She has the power to transform situations and manifest her visions into reality. 

I'd love for you to join me on Halloween night for something a little different than your typical costume party; something special... 

Join me in sacred space on Halloween night as we honor our wild and wise, witchy woman. We will embrace our shadow, indulge in our sensuality, unleash our creativity, and reclaim our power individually and collectively! 

HALLOWEEN NIGHT
Saturday, October 31st
6-9pm
Awakening NY
$35 in advance | $45 day of

+ there will be +
fire water earth air
laughter chills lots of care
song magic ritual dance
sacred ceremony lush romance

Come dressed as your best witch. Express yourself the way she wants to be expressed. You will leave feeling revitalized to continue your night out in the wilderness of New York City if you so choose. 

Register here: http://www.meredithedwards.com/event/sacredspace-witchywoman

All women welcome!
results.name: Sacred Space Witchy Woman - a Halloween event!

results.description:
Friends,

If you are interested in seeing the Halloween Parade Upclose and with thousands of other New Yorkers, join us for the parade and drinks at Boxers afterwards.

Route: The parade runs from Spring Avenue up Sixth Avenue to West 16th Street, and it starts at 7pm.  

If we hope to grab a good viewing spot, we will need to get our coffee, capuccinos, hot tea or water and be at our corner meeting spot by 6pm. 

Weather: Forecast calls for a cool & clear 48 Degrees - So dress accordingly, and bring your camera for some great pictures. 

Meeting at the Parade: Download GROUP's Free "Gay Catholics" Mobile App (itunes, google play, amazon, etc) - USE the app's Proximity "FRIENDS NEAR" Feature To FIND Group at the parade (this is in case we need to move due to crowds) 

For more info on the parade see the Parade and Timeout links below:

http://www.timeout.com/newyork/events-festivals/village-halloween-parade-nyc-guide 


https://www.halloween-nyc.com/

results.description:
Put on your "HALLOWEEN DISGUISE" and "hike on over" for this special celebration! Let your fantasies run wild and  be whoever or whatever you want! (COSTUMES are OPTIONAL)  Let's burn some calories dancing and drumming!  Bring a percussion instrument if you like (drum, tambourine, maracas, etc.) Lots of live entertainment in-between.  Come for an hour or two or stay for the whole event. The following is from Tommy Purple Haze , with "drums from heaven", who is sponsoring this joyful event:

Drums from Heaven 10'th Anniv.
Halloween Drum & Dance Ball
Oct 31'st, 2015 ~   6PM to 12AMV.F.W. ~ 44 Market St. Saddle Brook, N.J.
Tommy Purple Haze  presents ~~~Ubaka HillRhythm MonstersLife Movement Dancers
Interactive Drum & Dance CircleCostume contestPrizes/raffles/refreshments
$25. Door donation $20 advance tickets (See below)
Benefit: Million Women Drummers Gathering
www.MillionWomenDrummers.com A future for drums & wooden instruments, one tree at a time.
Merlin's Kids
http://www.merlinskids.org/ Animals & children helping each other,from shelter dog to service dog .
Dessert donations are welcome. 


Info @ Drums from Heaven on Facebook~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
For advance tickets see me at a variety of drum circles over the next 2 months. Or Please RSVP with stamped self addressed envelope with check. Please  stipulate which event you are  ordering tickets for .E-mail me for my address if doing mail order.
PS: I will be attending the drum circle in Belmar on Wednesday Sept16 with tickets available for Oct 31 and Nov 1.


Location :Saddle Brook V.F.W 44 Market St. Saddle Brook, N.J. 07663 DIRECTIONS: I-287E/I-87S TO EXIT 14A (GARDEN STATE PKWY SOUTH) TOWARD NJ. (11.8 MILES) TAKE EXIT 163 ON LEFT, MERGE ONTO NJ 17 S TOWARD RT 4/PARAMUS/GW BRIDGE. (3.2 MILES.) TAKE THE ESSEX ST EXIT TOWARD I-80W. SADDLE BROOK. TURN RT. AT ESSEX ST, CONTINUE ONTO MARKET ST. DESTINATION WILL BE ON YOUR LEFT. 

MEET US IN BACK PARKING LOT, WEATHER PERMITTING, OTHERWISE ON THE  PORCH or later in drum circle.  LOOK FOR SMALL MEETUP SIGN!

With Drink Specials, Candy, DJ, Ice Breakers, 300+ singles and Halloween falling on a Saturday night... this is gonna be one hell of a party!

What to expect: 


• Drink specials from 6:30pm-8:30pm 

• Complimentary Sweet Snacks

• DJ & Dancing 

• "Scary Movie" Ice Breaker for Prizes

• Professional Photography

• Costumes encouraged but not mandatory

• 300+ singles ready to mingle (20s, 30s, 40s)

• Mets World Series Game on all TVs

Tickets:

50% off tickets available for *$20 ($40 otherwise) 

*Only 20 tix avail at this price (goes up as event gets closer)

MUST PREPAY AT THIS LINK (NO tickets sold at the door):

Please note: The # of RSVP’s here reflect only a portion of those attending. We have 30+ groups co-organizing this event and expect 300+ singles.

To guarantee a spot you MUST pay in advance in addition to RSVPing. We are expecting to be SOLD OUT soon and tickets will NOT be sold at the door.

PREPAY ONLY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/halloweensingles/dates/Oct-31-2015_at_0630PM

results.description:
*** Halloween 2015! ***


                                             Upscale & Unhinged! 

                                                                 
                                                            If you:


                                                  Love Halloween

                                            Love Free Admission

                                    Love All Night Drink Specials

                           Love hanging out with cool friendly folks

                                         Love having a great time:

                        Then Join Us At Our Annual Halloween Party!  

                                                       Hey Gang:


                                          Besides New Year's Eve,  
                           Halloween is the most unhinged night 
                                    of the year and always a blast. 

                                          To Get Properly Unhinged: 

                                 There Will Be Drink Specials All Night.

                                                        Join us at 

                                                         49 Grove

                                 49 Grove Street, New York, NY 10014 

                                   Saturday, October 31th at 6:30 PM


                                           *** Admission Is Free! ***


         Stay tuned for the latest text of the list of sponsors 
            that will be giving out "Tricks & Treats" to everyone.  


          * There Will Be A Costume Contest With Cool Prizes! *


                   Joining us will be lots of members from many 
                                       more Meetup Groups. 


                 We expect a good turnout and lots and lots of fun!


                     If you have any questions, shoot me an e-mail.

       
                                                     Marcello 


                       
                                  Scenes from Halloween Past:

                                                       Join us!

                                                      
                                                 ***  RSVP Now  ***

                                                                ...
results.name: * Our 8th Annual Halloween Party! * *Admission Is Free!*

results.description:
https://www.halloween-nyc.com/

We'll meet next to the statue of Juan Pablo Duarte at 6th Ave & Canal at 8pm.   it is the only statute in that area - he faces south, and is on the sidewalk on 6th Ave between Grand & Canal, can't miss him.

venue.address_1: southwest corner of Metropolitan Avenue and Park Lane South
venue.name: Wallenberg Square

results.description:
We meet at 6:30 PM at Wallenberg square, start walking at 6:45 SHARP! We should be done around 8:00 PM so you can continue celebrating Halloween later in the evening.
Wear a costume if you desire, but not required.
Bring a flashlight as we will be walking thru dark wooded paths and streets after dark.
Maybe we will see some eerie and chilling Halloween sights in the woods.
A donation of $1.00 is requested to cover the Meetup site's cost.
CYA there!
results.name: Halloween Night Hike-6:30 PM-Forest Park Woods.

results.description:
Only those in costume are welcome to join…

hundreds of PUPPETS, 53 BANDS of Different Types of Music, DANCERS and ARTISTS, and thousands of other New Yorkers in costumes of their own creation in

…the nation’s most wildly creative public participatory event in the greatest city in the world!

Event Link: http://www.halloween-nyc.com/index.php

Wikipedia: New York's Village Halloween Parade is an annual holiday parade and street pageant presented on the night of every Halloween in New York City's Greenwich Village. Stretching more than a mile, this cultural event draws two million in-person spectators, more than sixty thousand costumed participants, dancers, artists and circus performers, dozens of floats bearing live bands and other musical and performing acts, and a world-wide television audience of one hundred million. The Village Halloween Parade, initiated in 1974 by Greenwich Village puppeteer and mask maker Ralph Lee, is the world's largest Halloween parade and the only major nighttime parade in the United States.

results.description:
Let's get together for the Halloween Alternative!

The word "Halloween" means "hallowed evening" or "holy evening". Who better to have a "holy evening" with than with the Marriage-Minded Christian Singles community!

The word "Halloween" comes from a Scottish term for All Hallows' Eve (the evening before All Hallows' Day). All Hallows' Day is the first day of a traditional religious feast dedicated to remembering the dead, including saints (hallows), martyrs, and all the faithful departed believers.

We could have some fun with this, maybe dressing up like our favorite bible characters. After all, who better to lift up than the faithful men and women of God described in the Bible. Maybe we can give out a prize for best costume!

There's also water, soda, and non-alcoholic beverages. Come early for Happy Hour (7-8pm), and stay late as there will be multiple bars will be open throughout the entire event!

------------------------


------------------------


Join us for the 3rd annual Halloween Stomp... a vintage inspired masquerade and costume party near Times Square, featuring over 35 performers including four hot jazz, swing, and blues bands; plus classic burlesque and vintage gogo dancers, swing DJs, video projections, and more!

Like something out of the twilight zone, this unqiue venue is in a century old nameless building that time forgot with the 2,500sq ft Grand Phantom Ballroom. Get lost in a myriad of rooms filled with curiosities and infernal live music. Come lounge and dance amongst sexy spirits, demonic dandies, fiendish flappers and be one of those "things" that go "bump" in the night.

Costumes (any style), or vintage attire encouraged and win cool prizes for the Costume Contest

Please join us and be prepared to dance the devil away!

results.description:
As part of our outreach to T.O.O.O.L.(The Open Organization Of LockPickers}, we are sponsoring a monthly Lockpicking event to encourage like minded individuals to gather, greet, and pick the night away!!!  No experience required, just a desire to learn is all that is needed.  Anyone can learn to pick, if you don't believe us, come on down to MakerBar and try it for yourself!

At this time, we are also requesting donations of locks, ...old rusty pad locks(or shiny new ones), door locks (old or shiny[we love shiny locks]), combination locks, handcuffs (with or without keys), prison shackles(no questions asked...wink, wink), practice locks, bicycle locks, key safes, combination safes, etc... in general anything that has a lock may be donated.   If you have any of the above mentioned locks, and would be happy to donate them, please bring them with you when you come to help increase the diversity of locks to pick.

Come have a beer (or two[we don't count]) with us, and have fun picking away with fellow pickers!! See you there!!

***As Always we remind newcomers to follow the two Golden Rules of Lock-Sport.....

1. Do Not Pick A Lock Without the Owners Consent (Your Neighbors Lock..No Good..)

2. Do Not Pick A Lock You Rely On.(Your house lock would fall into this category.)

Happy Picking!!!!***

**Open to the Public**


In parallel with OPEN CRAFT NIGHT:

Come on down and make stuff! Don't be shy, we love seeing new faces and meeting new MakerBarbians. Bring a project in any state, an idea, or just  come to hang out with us while we work on projects, WARNING spontaneous brainstorms are on the forecast.

This event is free and open to the public.   It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Doors open at 7PM

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

BRING PIRCTURES /KEEPSAKES of your deceased loved ones to celebrate & honor them and our ancestors for they are loved ….. 'HE WHO IS REMEMBERED LIVES….'

EACH PERSON SHOULD BRING A SMALL CARVED OUT PUMPKIN AND PLACE A SMALL BLACK VOTIVE IN THE CENTER of the pumpkins TO LIGHT THE WAY FOR OUR ANCESTORS.

We reflect on the Mysteries of ourselves and nature and honor the Goddesses and Gods of the Underworld.

14 and under must be accompanied by parent or adult guardian.

results.description:
There are some who might suggest that Halloween is not a vegan-friendly holiday. We beg to differ. 

Did you know, for example, that Frankenstein’s monster was vegan? At one point in the story he says: "My food is not that of man; I do not destroy the lamb and the kid to glut my appetite; acorns and berries afford me sufficient nourishment."

And of course there is Count Duckula, the vegetarian vampire.

And we all know what vegan zombies eat: Graaaaaaaains!


So there’s no excuse not to celebrate! 

Costumes welcome, but not required.

Please bring a vegan dish (no meat, fish, eggs, dairy, or honey) or drink to share. 


We’ll gather at 7:00 PM and dig in by 7:30 PM. After the food, those who are interested can join in playing games.


We’ll be celebrating at Noah’s apartment in Jackson Heights. We'll message you the exact address 24 hrs before. 7 train to 82nd St. or E/F/M/R to Jackson Heights/Roosevelt Ave. It’s a short walk from the 7 train at 82nd St. or E/F/R trains to Jackson Heights/Roosevelt Ave. 

Accessibility:

Transit: The Roosevelt Avenue train station at 74th street/Broadway on Roosevelt Avenue is an express stop. The E, F, R, M and 7 all stop there.  There is elevator access throughout the entire station.  This is also the bus terminal for the entire area.  The Q32, Q33 and Q34 buses all stop within one block of our host's apartment.  The 33 & 34 are located under the main canopy at the station. The 32 stops directly outside the terminal doors on Roosevelt Avenue.  Allow an additional 10-12 minutes if you're taking the bus.

Apartment: There are two steps leading up to the front door of the building, a landing and then three steps. Both sets have railings. Then there is an elevator. Unfortunately there is no ramp; the service entrance to the basement has stairs. Within the apartment, the living room is sunken, with two steps leading down to it.  If you have further questions, please message Noah through Meetup.

results.name: Vegan Halloween Potluck Celebration!

results.description:
We are going to dress up and participate in the parade, this is one of the craziest parades in the year!

**The only way to participate in the parade is if you are in costume!!**

Here's a bit of a description from the website...

"Only those in costume are welcome to join…
hundreds of PUPPETS, 53 BANDS of Different Types of Music, DANCERS and ARTISTS, and thousands of other New Yorkers in costumes of their own creation in
…the nation’s most wildly creative public participatory event in the greatest city in the world!"

We'll meet up at a Starbucks nearby at 7:00pm, then head over to start point on 6th Avenue and Canal Street a couple of blocks away. We might also head over to a place for a Halloween party in the city, I'll update more with that info soon, public transportation is suggested if you're coming out of NYC, because there will be major street closures, but it is possible to park nearby, contact me if you need any info on that.

results.description:
Charmed By Starr

And

The NYC Wiccan Family Temple

Present Our

9thAnnual Samhain Eve Ritual

Come celebrate A most magical night

The veil between the worlds are at its thinnest, Great Power & Energies.

All ages are welcome. Whatever path you follow: if you are a newcomer, Pagan, Witch, Druid, Shaman or not yet found your path.

BRING PIRCTURES /KEEPSAKES of your deceased loved ones to celebrate & honor them and our ancestors for they are loved ….. 'HE WHO IS REMEMBERED LIVES….'

EACH PERSON SHOULD BRING A SMALL CARVED OUT PUMPKIN AND PLACE A SMALL BLACK VOTIVE IN THE CENTER of the pumpkins TO LIGHT THE WAY FOR OUR ANCESTORS.

We reflect on the Mysteries of ourselves and nature and honor the Goddesses and Gods of the Underworld.

*BRING TO SHARE - BREAD, CAKES, COOKIES, WINES, JUICES, FOOD ETC.*

*COME IN COSTUME OR WEAR YOUR CAPES IF YOU WISH* 

(Costumes encouraged but optional)

*BRING HAND INSTRUMENTS -- drums, flutes, tambourines, claves, maracas, etc. (This helps raise energy)*

(MIDDLE GRASSY AREA)

Children ARE welcome

14 and under must be accompanied by parent or adult guardian.

www.wiccanfamilytemple.org; <a>www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org;</a> <a>www.witchsfestusa.org;</a> www.charmedbystarr.com

The Dancing Path™

is excited to present-

Wickedly Luminous

A Holistic

Halloween Party

Saturday, October 31st

7:45pm - 11pm

​

YogaVida

666 Broadway

3rd Floor

7:45 - 11:00pm

Chill Room

Complimentary Organic Juices

& Raw Chocolate Love

8:00- 9:00pm

Transformational Dances of Darkness & Light

w/Trinity

9:00- 10:30pm

Wicked Dance Party

w/DJ’s Hrana & Dave

10:30-11:00pm

Closing Circle + Prizes for Favorite Costumes

*Start and end times of activities are approximate.

8:00-9:00pm Transformational Dances of Darkness & Light

Trinity the founder of The Dancing Path™ will guide us through a fun, transformational and improvisational dance experience. This lightly facilitated dance will take us into higher states of unity, love, connection and playfulness. Dancers will be inspired by passionate music and powerful, creative, lightly guided, improvisational dance rituals. These dance rituals will empower you to expand your creativity and release your inhibitions- supporting you to dance wild, free and playful like a child. They will clear your energy and bring an experience of renewal to you, your body and your connection with others.

9:00-10:30pm

Wicked Dance Party w/Hrana & Dave (The Dancing DJ’s)

We continue the night with a Dance Party. Hrana & Dave are two of my favorite DJ’s. I meet them while they were DJ’ing at Dance Camp in New Hampshire. I kept going up to them while they were spinning and asking them the names of all the songs they were playing. They will be playing an eclectic mix of house, tribal, world, 80’s, mash up’s, dance remixes of older tracks and electronica that will posses your soul and make you dance.

7:45-11:00pm Chill-out Room

Chill, relax, recharge and connect while enjoying healthy delicious Complimentary Organic juices & Chocolate.

10:30-11:00pm Closing Circle & Prizes for Favorite Costumes

What kind of Costume do I wear?

Wear any kind of costume that you desire.

Your costume can be as simple or as elaborate as you like.

The point is to have fun so don’t stress too much about a costume.

At the bear minimum we ask that you wear a mask.

If you are costume challenged ask friends or look on Google for ideas.

This is a substance and alcohol free event!

Advance Registration is highly recommended!

Trinity’s last two holiday events sold out

$25. Early Bird (register by Sat Oct 24th)

$30. Advance (register by Fri Oct 30th)

$35. Day of (cash at the door)

More info & Register at-

http://wickedly-luminous-halloween.eventbrite.com/?nomo=1

Link for pictures from a previous event-

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.10204466446957685.1073741826.1127289530&type=1&l=8d6d836ae2

Testimonials- “Trinity leads this outrageously fun facilitated celebration with all of her heart, passion, power, and love. By the end, I always feel completely connected with myself and everyone in the room- a deep sense of community is created. It is a profound experience.” ~Doug Larson

“I feel like this is the best time I've had in a while! I came in not knowing what to expect. I left feeling empowered, light, open, centered and free. A lot of things surfaced for me in a wonderful way. I now feel closer to my heart. Thank you!” ~ Melissa D.

About Trinity- Trinity is the creator of the Dancing Path™ a celebratory transformational events organization that offers playful, creative, community building events, workshops, parties and trainings in NYC. She is passionate about bringing people together to celebrate life, express themselves fully and connect in fun and nurturing ways. One of Trinity’s main passions is to facilitate transformational dance. Her love and uninhibited passion for dance is infectious. Trinity has facilitated transformational dances at the Omega Institute, Princeton University, Jiva Mukti and many other wonderful places. In 2001 she studied Reiki and a few years later became a Reiki master. Shortly after Trinity studied at Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN) and got certified as a Holistic Health & Nutritional Counselor. During her studies at IIN she discovered Thai Massage and pursued training with Lotus Palm and in Thailand. Trinity is a 200 hour certified Yoga Instructor and has been teaching yoga for 15 years. She has also studied and been trained in Circus Yoga™, Hawaiian Lomi Lomi Massage, Deeksha aka the Oneness Blessing and Authentic Relating. www.meetup.com/thedancingpath/

The Dancing Path™ is excited and grateful to

have the following sponsors for this event-

Body Local

BodyLocal helps fitness professionals and wellness practitioners build thriving businesses so that they can deliver the highest quality programs & treatment to their students and clients who are then able to lead healthier and more productive lives. BodyLocal offers networking events, peer mentoring, marketing opportunities and business coaching. www.bodylocal.com

The Connection Movement

w/Amy Silverman

The Connection Movement is an oasis and playground for connection.

The ever-growing NY community comes together to explore ways of seeing, connecting, and appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level through social, workshop, and retreat settings. There are 6-10 gatherings per month that engage vulnerability, earnest connection and playing full out. Newcomers are welcomed with open arms and do not need to have prior experience. Founded in 2012 by Amy Silverman and Dan Sieling under the original name “Authentic Relating NY”, The Connection Movement is directed and facilitated by Amy Silverman.

www.connectionmovement.com

Daily Greens™

At DailyGreens™ we believe that food has a powerful impact on our health. We believe in the wonderful nutritious benefits of cold-pressed green juice. We press six pounds (9 servings) of raw, USDA Organic Certified and Non-GMO project verified produce into every 16oz bottle of Daily Greens™ core green juices, we craft quite delicious and nutritious beverages that are filled with a wide variety of vital nutrients and vitamins! So why just eat your veggies, when you can Drink Your Greens™? www.drinkdailygreens.com

Kseniya Vlasova
Graphic Artist & Painter

Kseniya is an amazing painter and graphic designer. She designed the flyer for my Halloween Party. As a prize for her favorite costume she will be offering a free consultation & 1 hour of graphic design work, to bring your vision into a compelling visual presentation (logo design, flyers, invites, posters, etc) Kseniya also designs handmade t-shirts and has her own Etsy store. You can check out her t-shirts at the website below. www.ptika.com [masked]

Mary Aranas

Mary is ERYT 500 and certified in ISHTA, AcroYoga, YogaSlackers and Thai Yoga bodywork. Mary teaches at Pure Yoga and Om Factory in NYC and leads workshops, retreats and Immersions. Mary has been featured in Yoga Journal, Fitness Magazine, Martha Stewart Whole Living Magazine, Alignyo and WellAndGoodNYC. Whether in Meditation, flying on someone's feet, or teaching you to base and fly and Thai, Mary is devoted to that prana wave of love, joy, and life force, which we were all born to surf. www.maryaranas.com


Trinity is the founder of The Dancing Path™
The Dancing Path is a celebratory transformational events organization that offers playful, creative, community building parties, workshops and trainings all over NYC. Join the Meetup group to stay informed of future events-www.meetup.com/thedancingpath/

results.description:
This is our yearly halloween party where we pull out all the stops and transform an entire house like it was one big creepy set for all to play in.


This year's theme: The Drowned Ball

Think "Under the Sea Dance" but with more Dagon, or an evening at the beach in Innsmouth. 


Costumes are mandatory.


Costume ideas: aquatic, undead and/or lovecraftian themes, examples: those undead sailors from Pirates of the Caribbean 2, that Innsmouth look, or just about anything with tentacles.  You don't have to come in theme though.

results.description:
Trinity, the founder of "The Dancing Path"  will guide us through a fun transformational and improvisational dance experience. I have attended her affairs before and I always leave in awe of myself and my fellow human beings. I am so glad she decided to have this affair on Halloween night in the village. There is so much information and details concerning this event you must go to her MEETUP SITE and view the gathering for yourself:   "transformational  dance, drum circle, & ecstatic events".  Also take a look at "Yoga Vida" to impress yourself with the beauty of the ambiance.

This is a costumed affair.  Plan something that will allow you to move around.  If your movement is physically  limited by handicap, desire or  design .... don't let that keep you at home.  Come on out and be a voyager.  You will still have a good time and a night to remember.

Remember the name of this group is :  60+ NYC "YOUNG AT HEART".   It is important that we get up and out and try NEW things or ......... "The Rocking Chair  Will Get YOU Where The GOOD LORD Split You".   

 Sorry for the pun.   But it is hard to believe that as of today  (Oct. 22, 2015)  only 3 people out of potentially 356 people  want to go.? ? ?

Look for me (April).  I plan to be dressed in  ALL WHITE with a white head band with ribbons and stars, or snow flakes. or snow balls or something......   REGISTER EARLY..... only $25.00 .........see you there.

She is passionate about bringing people together to celebrate life, express themselves fully and connect in fun and nurturing ways. One of Trinity’s main passions is to facilitate transformational dance. Her love and uninhibited passion for dance is infectious. Trinity has facilitated transformational dances at the Omega Institute, Princeton University, Jiva Mukti and many other wonderful places. In 2001 she studied Reiki and a few years later became a Reiki master. Shortly after Trinity studied at Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN) and got certified as a Holistic Health & Nutritional Counselor. During her studies at IIN she discovered Thai Massage and pursued training with Lotus Palm and in Thailand. Trinity is a 200 hour certified Yoga Instructor and has been teaching yoga for 15 years. She has also studied and been trained in Circus Yoga™, Hawaiian Lomi Lomi Massage, Deeksha aka the Oneness Blessing and Authentic Relating. www.meetup.com/thedancingpath/

The Dancing Path™ is excited and grateful to
have the following sponsors for this event-

Body Local
BodyLocal helps fitness professionals and wellness practitioners build thriving businesses so that they can deliver the highest quality programs & treatment to their students and clients who are then able to lead healthier and more productive lives. BodyLocal offers networking events, peer mentoring, marketing opportunities and business coaching. www.bodylocal.com

The Connection Movement w/Amy Silverman
The Connection Movement is an oasis and playground for connection. The ever-growing NY community comes together to explore ways of seeing, connecting, and appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level through social, workshop, and retreat settings. There are 6-10 gatherings per month that engage vulnerability, earnest connection and playing full out. Newcomers are welcomed with open arms and do not need to have prior experience. Founded in 2012 by Amy Silverman and Dan Sieling under the original name “Authentic Relating NY”, The Connection Movement is directed and facilitated by Amy Silverman.  www.connectionmovement.com

Daily Greens™
At DailyGreens™ we believe that food has a powerful impact on our health. We believe in the wonderful nutritious benefits of cold-pressed green juice. We press six pounds (9 servings) of raw, USDA Organic Certified and Non-GMO project verified produce into every 16oz bottle of Daily Greens™ core green juices, we craft quite delicious and nutritious beverages that are filled with a wide variety of vital nutrients and vitamins! So why just eat your veggies, when you can Drink Your Greens™? www.drinkdailygreens.com

Kseniya Vlasova
Graphic Artist & Painter
Kseniya is an amazing painter and graphic designer. She designed the flyer for my Halloween Party. As a prize for her favorite costume she will be offering a free consultation & 1 hour of graphic design work, to bring your vision into a compelling visual presentation (logo design, flyers, invites, posters, etc) Kseniya also designs handmade t-shirts and has her own Etsy store. You can check out her t-shirts at the website below. www.ptika.com <a>[masked]</a>

Mary Aranas
Mary is ERYT 500 and certified in ISHTA, AcroYoga, YogaSlackers and Thai Yoga bodywork. Mary teaches at Pure Yoga and Om Factory in NYC and leads workshops, retreats and Immersions. Mary has been featured in Yoga Journal, Fitness Magazine, Martha Stewart Whole Living Magazine, Alignyo and WellAndGoodNYC. Whether in Meditation, flying on someone's feet, or teaching you to base and fly and Thai, Mary is devoted to that prana wave of love, joy, and life force, which we were all born to surf. www.maryaranas.com

Halloween Party​

provided by DailyGreens™

YogaVida
666 Broadway
3rd Floor

7:45pm Doors Open
Complimentary Organic Juices & Mingling

8:00-9:00pm
Transformational Dances of Darkness & Light
with Trinity

9:00-10:30pm
Dance Party w/DJ’s Hrana & Dave(The Dancing DJs)
Dave will also be playing live drums

7:45-11:00pm
Chill Lounge
Relax, mingle & enjoy complimentary Organic drinks

10:30-11:00pm
Closing Circle + Prizes for Favorite Costumes

*Start and end times of activities are approximate.

8:00-9:00pm
Transformational Dances of Darkness & Light
Trinity the founder of The Dancing Path™ will guide us through a fun, transformational and improvisational dance experience. This lightly facilitated dance will take us into higher states of unity, love, connection and playfulness. Dancers will be inspired by passionate music and powerful, creative, lightly guided, improvisational dance rituals. These dance rituals will empower you to expand your creativity and release your inhibitions- supporting you to dance wild, free and playful like a child. They will clear your energy and bring an experience of renewal to you, your body and your connection with others.

9:00-10:30pm
Dance Party w/Hrana & Dave (The Dancing DJ’s)
Dave on Live Drums at various points of DJ set
We continue the night with a Dance Party. Hrana & Dave are two of my favorite DJ’s. I meet them while they were DJ’ing at Dance Camp in New Hampshire. I kept going up to them while they were spinning and asking them the names of all the songs they were playing. They will be playing an eclectic mix of house, tribal, world, 80’s, mash up’s, dance remixes of older tracks and electronica that will posses your soul and make you dance. Dave will also be playing live drums at various points during the DJ set.

7:45-11:00pm
Chill-out Room
Relax, recharge and connect while enjoying healthy delicious complimentary organic beverages in the lounge area.

10:30-11:00pm
Closing Circle & Prizes for Favorite Costumes

What kind of Costume do I wear?
The point is to have fun so don't stress too much about a costume.
Wear any kind of costume that you desire.
Your costume can be as simple or as elaborate as you like.
At the bear minimum we ask that you wear a mask.
If you are costume challenged ask friends or look on Google for ideas.

This is a substance and alcohol free event!

Advance Registration is highly recommended!
The last two holiday events sold out

Transformational Dances of Darkness & Light
Trinity the founder of The Dancing Path™ will guide us through a fun, transformational and improvisational dance experience. This lightly facilitated dance will take us into higher states of unity, love, connection and playfulness. Dancers will be inspired by passionate music and powerful, creative, lightly guided, improvisational dance rituals. These dance rituals will empower you to expand your creativity and release your inhibitions- supporting you to dance wild, free and playful like a child. 9:00-10:30pm
Dance Party w/Hrana & Dave (The Dancing DJ’s)

We continue the night with a Dance Party. Hrana & Dave are two of my favorite DJ’s. I meet them while they were DJ’ing at Dance Camp in New Hampshire. I kept going up to them while they were spinning and asking them the names of all the songs they were playing. They will be playing an eclectic mix of house, tribal, world, 80’s, mash up’s, dance remixes of older tracks and electronica that will posses your soul and make you dance. Dave will also be playing live drums at various points during the DJ set.

7:45-11:00pm

What kind of Costume do I wear?
The point is to have fun so don't stress too much about a costume.
Wear any kind of costume that you desire.
Your costume can be as simple or as elaborate as you like.
At the bear minimum we ask that you wear a mask.
If you are costume challenged ask friends or look on Google for ideas.

This is a substance and alcohol free event!

Testimonials- “Trinity leads this outrageously fun facilitated celebration with all of her heart, passion, power, and love. By the end, I always feel completely connected with myself and everyone in the room- a deep sense of community is created. It is a profound experience.” ~Doug Larson

“I feel like this is the best time I've had in a while! I came in not knowing what to expect. I left feeling empowered, light, open, centered and free. A lot of things surfaced for me in a wonderful way. I now feel closer to my heart. Thank you!” ~ Melissa D.

About Trinity- Trinity is the creator of the Dancing Path™ a celebratory transformational events organization that offers playful, creative, community building events, workshops, parties and trainings in NYC. She is passionate about bringing people together to celebrate life, express themselves fully and connect in fun and nurturing ways. One of Trinity’s main passions is to facilitate transformational dance. Her love and uninhibited passion for dance is infectious. Trinity has facilitated transformational dances at the Omega Institute, Princeton University, Jiva Mukti and many other wonderful places. In 2001 she studied Reiki and a few years later became a Reiki master. Shortly after Trinity studied at Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN) and got certified as a Holistic Health & Nutritional Counselor. During her studies at IIN she discovered Thai Massage and pursued training with Lotus Palm and in Thailand. Trinity is a 200 hour certified Yoga Instructor and has been teaching yoga for 15 years. She has also studied and been trained in Circus Yoga™, Hawaiian Lomi Lomi Massage, Deeksha aka the Oneness Blessing and Authentic Relating. www.meetup.com/thedancingpath/

The Dancing Path™ is excited and grateful to
have the following sponsors for this event-

Body Local
BodyLocal helps fitness professionals and wellness practitioners build thriving businesses so that they can deliver the highest quality programs & treatment to their students and clients who are then able to lead healthier and more productive lives. BodyLocal offers networking events, peer mentoring, marketing opportunities and business coaching. www.bodylocal.com

The Connection Movement w/Amy Silverman
The Connection Movement is an oasis and playground for connection. The ever-growing NY community comes together to explore ways of seeing, connecting, and appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level through social, workshop, and retreat settings. There are 6-10 gatherings per month that engage vulnerability, earnest connection and playing full out. Newcomers are welcomed with open arms and do not need to have prior experience. Founded in 2012 by Amy Silverman and Dan Sieling under the original name “Authentic Relating NY”, The Connection Movement is directed and facilitated by Amy Silverman.  www.connectionmovement.com

Daily Greens™
At DailyGreens™ we believe that food has a powerful impact on our health. We believe in the wonderful nutritious benefits of cold-pressed green juice. We press six pounds (9 servings) of raw, USDA Organic Certified and Non-GMO project verified produce into every 16oz bottle of Daily Greens™ core green juices, we craft quite delicious and nutritious beverages that are filled with a wide variety of vital nutrients and vitamins! So why just eat your veggies, when you can Drink Your Greens™? www.drinkdailygreens.com

Kseniya Vlasova
Graphic Artist & Painter
Kseniya is an amazing painter and graphic designer. She designed the flyer for my Halloween Party. As a prize for her favorite costume she will be offering a free consultation & 1 hour of graphic design work, to bring your vision into a compelling visual presentation (logo design, flyers, invites, posters, etc) Kseniya also designs handmade t-shirts and has her own Etsy store. You can check out her t-shirts at the website below. www.ptika.com <a>[masked]</a>

Mary Aranas

venue.name: Hotel Woodbridge at Metro Park Fomerly -Woodbridge Hilton

results.description:
Huge Halloween Dance Party in the Grand Ballroom at the Woodbridge Hotel. Join Us this Saturday at this Elegant Venue for a Fun Night Of Dancing, Mixing & Mingling with other Singles. Prizes will be given for Best Costumes. Costumes are Optional. Great DJ Music from Past to Present.
Huge Crowd Expected. Admission $15. Don't Miss It!
results.name: Halloween Dance Party Oct 31st Grand Ballroom Woodbridge Hotel

venue.name: Bridgestone's Comedy Club inside Mara's Cafe

results.description:
I have been trying to figure out what I wanted to do for Halloween this year, I hate big parties, I wanted to be home to pass out candy, I didn't feel like doing a party here.......and then Matt contacted me about an awesome event he has going on and even offered to give me and my peeps discount tickets! So here it is:


Cassie Presents A Halloween Hypnotist Comedy Show plus afterparty at Bridgestones Comedy Club In South Amboy. Sat Oct 31. 8pm till Close. Save $ by buying in advance

Cassie's groups have had some really fun nights at Bridgestone's Comedy Club and this Halloween promises to be a classic.  Hypno Mark is a world renown comic hypnotist and he will be the nights entertainment.  We will also have some opening act stand up comics and a D.J. after party.  Tickets are normally $20 in advance and $25 at the door but if you sign up here you can get in for $15.  There's also a standard 2 item minimum.  The club is inside of Mara's located at 540 Catherine Street in South Amboy on route 35 North.  Email any questions to [masked]

get tickets here: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/cassie-presents-a-halloween-hypnotist-comedy-show-plus-afterparty-at-bridgestones-comedy-club-in-tickets-18946888654

So plan is I will get there shortly before 8pm, I may bring Jeremy depending on if he has plans or not. When you get there just ask Matt for my table.

I hope to see YOU there but no matter where you end up this night have a very Happy Halloween!

Love, Cassie
results.how_to_find_us: ask for Cassie

results.description:
Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].

Halloween; some love it, some hate it and we have put together the perfect gathering for both!  Join us for some good old fashioned Halloween Fun where costumes are optional but having fun is not!  We've reserved the entire club at Lexington's at The Cort Hotel for a fun night of mixing, mingling, drinking, dancing and games.  Best of all IT"S FREE!!!!

Lexington's is a cozy lounge in the lobby of the Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex.  There is plenty of room to socialize, enjoy a special Halloween cocktail, sit and relax, dance and play our games.

The night will feature:

-FREE Admission all night

-Drink specials till 9pm

-Fun games like bobbing for apples and complete the creep

-Music played at conversational levels until 10pm when we turn it up for a little dancing

-Complimentary billiards all night

-Costume contest for male/ female and group

Can I come alone? Yes, 97% of those attending will likely come on their own.  Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others.

If I don't have a costume will I feel stupid?  No, about 30% of those attending will have no or minimal costumes. Keep it simple, come for the fun and socializing.

When should I get there? Whenever you wish but the best time will be between 8-11pm

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

Happy Haunting!

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

PROMO VIDEO WITH PHOTOS FROM LAST YEARS HALLOWEEN PARTY:

https://youtu.be/Uv-Bgxv21BA


The Biggest Halloween Costume Party In North Jersey Has Arrived!

Join us on Saturday October 31st for a spooky evening of fun, dancing, socializing, and incredible costumes. Ruby Lounge is next to a Holiday Inn Hotel and has a separate entrance. Just look for the Ruby Sign to know where to enter.

Doors Open At 8pm And We Party Til Late!

Over $1000 In Cash & Prizes Given Out That Night. Top Cash Prize Going To The Best, The Sexiest, And Most Original Halloween Costumes. Additional Runner Up Prize Of 1 Free Hotel Stay Also Given Out.


DJ Morgan and another special guest DJ will be playing a nice mix of 70's, 80's, 90s, current top 40, freestyle, & more upbeat dance music to get you moving and grooving.


$10 Cover For Meetup Members At The Door.

Prepay Option Also Available. Pay Today For Guaranteed Entrance Plus An Added Bonus.

Bonus - Be Entered Into A Raffle Done Online A Few Days Before Event. 2 Lucky Winners Will Have There Admission Price Refunded & Have Free Entrance To The Halloween Party!


Click Here To Pay Online Now (Select Pay With Card Option): https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=S85RKGB766BLG

Free Parking In There Huge Lot.

Multiple Meetup Groups As Well As The General Public Will Be In Attendance.

Ruby Lounge Is Off Route 46 West, Make A Right @ The Petco Sign. Then Go Right Again And Park To The Left Parking Lot. Then Walk Across To Ruby Lounge Entrance.

Ruby Has A Fully Stocked Bar As Well As A Food Menu To Order From.

results.description:
Well it is that time of year again, Halloween. And Everything Brooklyn is hosting the perfect Meet-Up for those who prefer to avoid trekking to overcrowded Manhattan. Join us, with or without a costume, on what I expect will, a fun, evening.

Here is the plan. Of course, subject to change. I will post a comment if it does.

8:00 - 8:45 - McMahon's - 39 5th Ave
9:00 - 9:45 - High Dive - 243 5th Avenue

Afterwards we will head over to Union Hall for Crazy Since Da 90's. 702 Union (off the corner of 5th and Union)

Admission before 11 pm is free but you must reserve a spot. See the link:

http://www.unionhallny.com/event/977977-crazy-since-da-90s-brooklyn/

Just an FYI  - At Union Hall we will be in the basement, and there will be limited cell phone reception.   Most likely I won't be able to reply to your calls/texts at that point.

I should be easy to find in the bar(s)  but just in case my cell is[masked] 2767.

results.description:
Russell, friend to the group, is throwing a Halloween party in his basement. Feel free to join. Only rule: you must have a costume. That's not really a rule of his, but I just added that because it's FREAKIN' Halloween and costumes are awesome.

------------------------------------------------------------------

Russell writes:


The vegan Halloween of your dreams.


More details soon, but expect organic pumpkin spice vodka, pounds and pounds of organic candy, fresh baked goodies, good music and much more.

I'll be doing costume prizes.

More details to come.

My basement is huge and full of couches, so don't worry, it'll be comfy

Invite your vegan friends, veg-curious, and significant other. Omni folk are of course welcome!

BRING BOOZE AND OR SNACKS!


--------------------------------------------------------------------

So you heard it from Russell, guys. I'll be there and I hope you can make it too! Stay or just stop by!

(Side bar: Regardless of whether or not you're coming to the party, anyone wanna schedule a day to go costume shopping with me? We could probably do lunch or something afterward.)

Join over 300 singles ages 20s, 30s, and early 40s for our 8th Annual Halloween Singles Costume Party + World Series! We'll have drink specials, a fun "ice breaker" game to make it easy for singles to meet, and great giveaways. The World Series Game will show on over 20 screens throughout the venue! We have partnered with over 100 other Singles Meetup groups to host the biggest Halloween Singles Party!

• Over 300 singles! • World-renowned DJ EZ Calderon will be spinning top 40, hip hop, and dance music.

• Drink specials all night - $5 wine and well drinks, $4-6 beers

results.description:
It's considered the most anticipated holiday of the year, and the one day when we can all dress up and act out of character.

Before you know it, October will creep up on your, and you'll be dedicating all of your time to planning an awesome Halloween night. Parties take place all over the city, and even though apartments, homes, nightclubs, and lounges are the prime destinations, wouldn't it be nice to have a different option?

That's where this Halloween cruises come in. Be prepared to bring your friends along for this epic ride. You're going to have music, dancing, and be able to indulge in your favorite cocktails as you cruise around the city and take in the best views that it has to offer from the outside in.
Dinner will also be provided for a great cost.

Saturday October 31, 2015
Horn Blower Infinity
Boarding 8PM-10PM Sail 10PM-2AM
$60.00

*********Costumes Required*********

(This event is NOT meant to be age specific or gender balanced. All are welcome. Costumes are suggested but optional)

==========================================

Part 1- 8 PM-10 PM: Exclusive singles only
Part 2- After party- 10 PM- 4 AM

*Cash Bar

*Halloween costume prize contest
* DJ Spinning tunes all night long

or

results.description:
This Halloween, you are cordially summoned to lose yourself in decadent debauchery and naughty escapades at the incomparable Annual Haunted Lexicon Ball. Join Manhattan’s beautiful angels and seductive demons in opulent hellfire revelry at its finest inside New York City’s lavish Nightclub that will surely be the talk and the toast of the town on Hallow's night.

Lexicon’s immense 5,000sf, multi-level is complimented by a massive sunken dance floor, state of the art sound and light systems, multiple glorious bars and plasmas galore. Disco balls. Neon. Crazy light shows - ideal for partygoers to mix, mingle, frisk, frolic and cavort the night away in supreme style. With serious modern vibes and a consistently hot crowd of NYC’s finest nightlife revelers, the party at Lexicon is one reeling, rocking affair, always roiling with energy, and ready to take your Halloween Weekend right to the edge.

Nightlife’s foray into Halloween’s signature diabolical mischief and mayhem behind the velvet ropes is surely not for the timid or the faint at heart but there’s always tomorrow to redeem your wicked ways!

If youre a party-goer with that VIP taste, indulge in one of our exclusive VIP ticket Packages that offer guests coveted private seating along with Bottle Service.

Whats your party principle? Cash bar, open bar, bottles and more. On this fabulously freaky night, the choice is yours so indulge your inner sinner and give in to sin. You can always redeem your wicked ways tomorrow. 

Highlights to the hottest Halloween night ticket in town include :

* Trick or treat! Complimentary vodka cocktails from 9pm-10pm 
* Dj Harsh & Dj Amit spinning epic mixes of Desi & Dance on a pumping state of the art sound system
* Photographers to capture all the shameless, legendary mischief-making one night can handle!
* Cash Prize For Costume Contest
* Strictly 21 & Over.

For Group Discounts :[masked]
results.name: Desi Saturdays Presents..HAUNTED LEXICON BALL - A Desi Halloween Party @ Lexicon

results.description:
Join Us for A Halloween Soiree at Black Hound 


Purchase Your Ticket Today: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/halloween-2015-at-the-black-hound-tickets-18679848931

The Black Hound is a contemporary prohibition-era downtown Speakeasy, offering exquisitely crafted cocktails created by acclaimed New York City mixologist Jeremy Strawn.

Enter The Black Hound through an unassuming door into an amber lit room handsomely appointed with lots of dark wood and leather, plus a dusty gold sheen over everything from the tables to the patterned wallpaper - the perfect setting for Halloween.

Come celebrate the spookiest night of the year in the front room at the sleek white marble topped bar, or venture into the back lounge to unwind on a sofa or in an armchair. No matter which room you choose, a drink is not far away...

 And it all starts at 9:00pm sharp on Saturday October 31, 2015. 

With a bar that spans the length of the venue, you know you won't be waiting long for a drink.... just don't wait too long to get your ticket, because this party always sells out! 

Enjoy a live DJ performance and dancing with fellow New Yorkers dressed in their Halloween best.

Purchase your tickets today:

</a><a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/halloween-2015-at-the-black-hound-tickets-18679848931">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/halloween-2015-at-the-black-hound-tickets-18679848931

results.description:
This Halloween falls on a Saturday, so get your costumes ready and let's turn up!

We'll be going to Empire Hotel's Monster Bash for an awesome rooftop party with amazing views.

Tickets are $40/person and include an hour of a vodka open bar and access to their west terrace with a private bar.

You can get additional information and tickets by clicking here.

The open bar is super early [from 9-10], so I plan on arriving around 9:30 [though you can get there as early as 9].

We'll stay until around 12 or so and afterwards will head over to 53rd and 6th [5 minute cab ride / 15 minute walk] for some late night grub at the famous chicken and rice halal guys.

If you haven't tried this place out yet, you've been missing out. It's the best post-party food NYC has to offer [my humble opinion].

Lastly, just leave a comment below once you've purchased your tickets so we know who to expect for the evening.

See you all then!
results.how_to_find_us: if you can't find us, call / text me at 516.567.1996

results.description:
DESI SATURDAYS 
"New York's Only Weekly Saturday Night DesiParty"

:: L E X I C O N ::
226 East 54th St. NYC

Music By New York's Finest:
DJ HARSH - DJ AMIT

Percussive Dhol Beats By :
RAVI BINDRA

Doors Open at 10PM

COMPLIMENTARY ADMISSION TILL 11:30PM 
&
SPONSORED VODKA OPEN BAR 10-11PM

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

Dress Code: Trendy & Chic

Absolutely No T-shirts or No sneakers.

21+ | ID Required

For Table Reservations : 908 - 425 - 1603

Everyone Must RSVP @ www.DesiSaturdays.com 

Nearest Subway To Lexicon:
53rd St - Lex Ave (E,M,6)
59th St - Lex Ave (N,Q,R,4,5)

Dear Friends, 

The scariest, funniest, craziest, sexiest and extravagant event of the year has arrived "Halloween Night" get ready to let your wild side out and join us in this super fun event, interesting prizes for the best costumes will be given, and of course all the best in Latin Pop, Brazilian, House, Top 40s, 80s, 90s, Rock en Español, Cumbias, Merengue, Salsa and more!! 

Expect the unexpected in the craziest event of the year!!! 

P.S. We thank all of those who made it to our last event @ Space Ibiza New York with hurricane Joaquin!!

Saturday October 31st from 10pm to 4am

Tender NYC  is in the heart of New York City and hosts a metropolitan crowd, serving artisan libations and unique fusion . From floor to ceiling, Tender is exquisite with its lavishly painted hardwood floors, eye-catching cerulean blue leather banquettes, and rustic exposed bring walls. Tender features  a generous drop-down projector for the ultimate entertainment event. Tender is a one-stop playground for all the DESI NIGHT LIFE ACTIVITIES

results.description:
Last Stop Laughs is a new weekly late night Stand Up Show featuring Astoria's best comics. It's the perfect way to end your Saturday night in the Astoria Ditmars area.

10:30 doors / 11PM show NO Cover

Cap off your Halloween Night at QED with Last Stop Laughs.

FreddyG and Judith George will be bringing together some of their favorite dark comics who will be appearing in costume.

There will also be a costume contest at QED an hour before the show.

Headlining the Show will be Justin Smith (PBS/MTV). Justin moved to NYC from Oklahoma in the beginning of 2015 and immediately took the underground comedy scene by storm. His blunt conversational style should not be missed. This will be one of Justin’s first headlining spots in NYC.

Opening for Justin will be Wendi Starling (Fuse TV). Check Wendi out here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hqxCvzkLndU

Also Featuring:

Matt Maran (Sleeveless Insult Comic)

Adam Gable (Scary Deep Voiced Comic)

And the Producers: Judith George and the Jack O Lantern Haired FreddyG

Hosted by Usama Siddiquee (New York Comedy Club/The PIT)

*Lineups subject to change.

The first of November has been officially designated by the UN as World Vegan Day and the beginning of World Vegan Month. Take the day and give up animal products (meat, milk, ice cream, leather, etc) for the animals, your health and for the environment. You might be surprised how easy it is and you may decide to give it up longer.

So take this day to help our planet by being a vegan for a day (or longer).

results.name: TCS New York City Marathon (Various Starts)

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Last year, we had one member run the NYC Marathon and several people suggested we get a team to volunteer at the race.  And this year, we currently have at least one member running(our very own Ritchie E!).  This can be a lot of fun, so I decided to set something up.

It takes thousands of volunteers to help make this world-renowned event happen, so I’m hoping we can find some truly committed folks to come out and support the runners and represent Beer Club !

Full disclosure up front—this is a serious commitment. By volunteering, you’re agreeing to stand on your feet from 7:00 am- 4:00 pm and help pass out water to runners, clean up cups and do other volunteer-y sorts of tasks. It’s not for the faint of heart. It could be cold, wet or windy…or all three.

On the other hand, you get to be part of an amazing event which features runners from all over the world coming to NYC for the most well known race on the planet.

There are also lots of good beer places nearby so afterwards, we could all probably use a beer.

So, if you think you can commit, here’s what you need to do:

Go to https://mynyrr.nyrr.org/login

-If you are a NYRR member and have a login, log in. If you are not, you can create a login.

-Once you have logged in, go to the “volunteer” tab on the left side of the screen.

-Then scroll down to “Fluid Stations 2015 TCS New York City Marathon” and click “volunteer”

-Scroll down and select “Fluid Station Mile 15-Queens”

Note: This location (Fluid Station-Mile 15 Queens (Crescent Avenue between 43rd and 44th)) is close to the 7, N, Q, R and E trains, so I selected this for it’s central location, ease of access and 7:00 am start time (rather than 6:00 am)

-Then scroll down and click “Next”

-Complete the volunteering details. For the Volunteering Group, select “NYC Gay Craft Beer Club” from the drop down list so that they’ll know you’re with the group.

-Accept the documents and you’re registered!


**Deadline to register is Aug 31***


Hope a lot of you out there can join me for this incredible event. I volunteered a few years ago and had an amazing time.

Cheers,

Bill
results.name: Let's volunteer for the 2015 TCS New York City Marathon (and drink beer after)

group.name: New York City Gay Craft Beer Lovers

My organization American Friends of Beit Issie Shapiro, a nonprofit that works with children with disabilities, is looking for runners for the NYC Marathon! We have about 3 more spots to fill and it's free to register and we were hoping you or someone in the group would be interested in running for our team. All you will have to do is raise $3,000 by November 1 (day of race) but it's not too difficult if you ask your friends, family and ask your company to sponsor you!

Our Crowdrise team is here and you would click “Fundraise for this Campaign” in order to join: https://www.crowdrise.com/ShapiroNYC2015/fundraiser/theamericanfriendsof3
