results.description:
Because of the 30 seat strict limit for Room 505 and the demand for seats I am asking each DNNY member to RSVP RIGHT NOW so I then can reserve one seat for you while we still have seats. (They will be all taken and then you will not be able to get in on Sunday, Nov. 1 at 2pm sharp. 

Again, make your reservation right now by emailing me directly with your full name and asking for one seat to be reserved for you.


Nick

Date:Sunday, Nov. 1, 2015

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), 5th Floor, Room 505, NYC

Time: 2pm-5pm Please arrive 10 minutes in the lobby before 2pm meeting begins in the assigned room! Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment” if you need help in finding the room. Try to be on time as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting.

Topic(s): “Methodical Illusion & Methodical Deception”

Featured Guest Speaker: REBEKAH ROTH

Program (Live Event):Rebekah Roth, author of the much talked about book Methodical Illusion followed by her second book which is receiving rave reviews, Methodical Deception, both being hailed as "game changers" and "in a class of investigative reporting all by themselves" that blows the lid off the official story of 9/11 with newly uncovered facts that are truly riveting. Also, we have extended this meeting time one more hour till 5pm because of the huge scope and details of Rebekah's research and to allow more time for a Q&A, so the DNNY meeting will be running from 2pm to 5pm!

Bio: Rebekah Roth enjoyed a nearly thirty year airline career working as both a flight attendant and an international purser. She was trained as an emergency medical technician and served as a volunteer firefighter.

Her expertise and training as a flight attendant allowed her to research the events of September 11, 2001, with an insider’s knowledge that eventually lead her to discover details and answers to some of the most haunting questions surrounding that infamous day in our history.

Rebekah enjoyed a very exciting life both in the air and on the ground and because of that, was encouraged by co-workers to write a book. As she began to do that, she discovered that ten of the accused 9/11 hijackers were still alive. Several of them were also airline employees employed with Saudi Arabia Airlines and that they had had their identifications stolen years prior to 9/11. At least four of the accused hijackers threatened to sue the U.S. Government and the FBI if they did not stop using their names and identities.

That discovery, along with the refusal by the U.S. government to discontinue their false accusations, ignited her curiosity. After thousands hours of research, using official government documents, print and video media from 9/11, and several books, Rebekah discovered that there were also at least two women involved in the 9/11 event. Using her personal knowledge of in-flight procedures, FAA hijacking protocols, the state of Massachusetts and cell phone technology, she discovered yet to be exposed details concerning the planes, the passengers and the perpetrators which are woven into “Methodical Illusion”.

In the months following the release of Methodical Illusion, Rebekah had several people contact her with more information that had never been made public, so she decided to weave that new information into a sequel and the “Methodical Deception” was born.

The novel format helps the reader to learn about the FAA protocols and behaviors that would be expected by the flight crews, along with other information about people and corporations Rebekah discovered were involved in the planning or execution and/or the financial gain from the fourteen years of wars in the Islamic countries of the Middle East.

Rebekah's mission in choosing to write these books was to help the person who had never investigated 9/11 or had always had some doubt about the official story, to see the event through the eyes of an airline professional as her main character, very much like herself wakes up to the truth and discovers what happened to the planes, the passengers and crew members that unforgettable day in our history.

Meeting Format: The meeting will be done on either Skype and will start promptly at 2pm so please be on time. Your co0peration on this is appreciated. Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting DNNY meetings to date and invite your interested friends to join us!

For questions/comments or Press please contact: Nick Curto, DNNY Director/Co-Founder: E-mail: [masked] Phone/Text:[masked]

Meeting Details: Admission $10 per person. Children 12 and under admitted free. Our treasurer will collect your admission fee in the meeting room before the program begins.


R.S.V.P. Strongly recommended for people attending the meeting for the first time. Provide full name, e-mail address and cell phone number per person.

3 Important Notes:

1. No food or beverages are allowed in any rooms of the venue except bottled water that may be brought into the venue. You can also purchase chilled bottled water at the Welcome Desk in the Lobby for $1.
2. Please silence your cell phones when entering the meeting room.
3. No photos may be taken or sound recording is ever allowed at any of the DNNY meetings.

Please visit: www.dnny.info

Come and experience Namaste's NEW Spiritual Book Club!

November 1st at 3PM and ending at 5PM at Namaste Healing Center and we will be discussing the Untethered Soul by Michael A. Singer

So even if it's your first time reading this great classic or your tenth, come in next Sunday to be inspired and share your insights with like minded Souls.

The new Spiritual Book club will be lead by Jane Dowd Oosterom.  

Jane has just returned to New York from the Netherlands where she had the great experience to lead the Spiritual Book Club at the American Book Center in Amsterdam.  

Jane's passion is teaching and facilitating meditation groups and has a vast spectrum of experiences from a career on Wall Street, a masters in Holistic Ministry and the gift of being a wife and mother.  

Following her passion, she is very excited for the opportunity to create a space where you can share your insights and help shed light on the path leading to your authentic Self.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change.

results.description:
[Cross-posted from NYC Stoics]

Want to learn the basics of the theory and practice of Stoicism? Then join us at this meetup! 

Since 2012, a multi-disciplinary team centered at the University of Exeter composed of classicists, philosophers, psychologists, and psychotherapists have put together a free, distance-learning course called Stoic Week accompanied by online support. For a week, you'll be given daily readings and exercises to learn the basics of Stoicism and how to put it to practice in the modern world. They also test Stoicism's efficacy by administering validated psychometrics before and after Stoic Week to see if and how Stoic practice works.

Stoic Week 2015 runs from November 2-8. And, as we've done for the past couple of years, the NYC Stoics will have meetups bracketing Stoic Week to help give you extra support for your practice.

This meetup is intended to help you sign up for Stoic Week if you haven't already (I'll try to bring a computer). We'll also cover the introductory material. Finally, we'll have plenty of time for open discussion to answer both basic and advanced questions about Stoicism. So, if you're new to Stoicism, this is a great meetup for you to attend, whether or not you plan on participating in Stoic Week 2015!

To prepare for this meetup, please do the following:

• Sign up for Stoic Week 2015 if you are able to and want to participate (you don't have to participate in Stoic Week 2015 to attend this meetup though, as we're also having open discussion around Stoicism)

• If you signed up successfully, browse the "preliminary" section of the Stoic Week 2015 website, and read the introductory material of the Stoic Week 2015 Handbook (to be released October 31 in PDF, ePub, and HTML, up to but not including Monday's assignment)

• Come prepared with any questions or discussion points you'd like to bring up for our open discussion period

For more information about Stoic Week, please read this blog post.

Finally, please note that Daylight Saving Time ends Sunday 11/1 (the day of the meetup) at 2AM, so make sure you account for that!
results.name: Introduction to Stoic Week 2015 (and Stoicism in General)

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Monday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Tuesday, an email will be sent, listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance or read and mark up electronic comments.

Stories can be any length up to approx. 7,000 words. Flash fiction welcome.

You can submit your story to me (Marcy) directly, or submit to Dropbox per the Procedures (see below). My email is [masked].

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. Read through our Short Story Group Procedures for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure to make sure critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, so writers leave with a clear idea of what to do next with their stories.

We also spend time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know!

Flash pieces: If there is time (and there usually is), we can critique one or two last minute flash pieces that weren't submitted. Best method is to print out a copy for each participant. We will read the story there and give on-the-spot critiques.
results.name: Marcy's Short Story Meetup

results.description:
Note: I need to postpone the meetup to the 3:05 show.  Sorry for any headaches.


----


Young housewife Helena has always dreamed of opening her own business. When a fully-furnished vacant space opens up, she decides to finally fulfill this dream by opening a neighborhood grocery store. On the same day she signs the lease to the shop, her husband Otávio is suddenly fired from his job as an insurance executive, leaving Helena to support her husband and daughter alone.

The role reversal at home threatens to overturn the established structure of her domestic universe and ultimately begins to affect her personal relationship with her family. As pressure surmounts, Helena's temper flares and catapults her into a psychological breakdown. When the brick walls of her building start to crumble, groceries disappear, and a mysterious black substance begins creeping through the tiles of her floor, HARD LABOR takes a dark and suspenseful turn.

Is it supernatural, or is it the manifestation of Helena's paranoia and disintegrating psyche? A subtle neo-noir thriller wrapped in unconventional horror elements, HARD LABOR is a disturbing approach to an otherwise common crisis of a middle class family struggling to make it in a capitalist society.

http://www.cinemavillage.com/chc/cv/show_movie.asp?movieid=3520

----------------------------------------------

A good pick for the spirit of Halloween weekend.  And our first Brazilian pick.  The film starts at 3:05 and I will be there about 20 minutes before.

Looking forward to seeing you there. 


-John

PS. If anyone has suggestions for a good post-movie bar near East 12th where we can sit and have a big table then please let me know.  I would love to have at least one candidate establishment by Sunday.

results.description:
Central Park is one of the most beautiful parts of New York City!  It is even more stunning as the fall colors are at starting to show below the city skyline.  This opportunity does not last long and there is no better way to experience it than to be with dozens of fun and friendly members of our group !  Your guide will share with you the history of the park from its heyday to decline and then rebirth. He will show you amazing pictures  from before the park was there to vintage shots from the late 18 and 1900's.  You will learn of it's construction, design, special secrets and more as the sun shines on a crisp fall day.

We have timed the tour to end in time for the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity


Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own.

Won't the park be crowded because of the marathon?  Not too bad by that time, beside we will be starting away from the main area and get to finish near the finish line to get to see all the excitement.


What should I wear?  Dress for the weather

What if it rains? We will monitor the weather and send out a final notice by 8am on Saturday morning. Refunds will be sent only if the tour is canceled

Where do we meet?  You will meet the group at Good Enough to eat Restaurant on Columbus and 85th at 3pm sharp.  The NYC Marathon is that day so make sure you check the train schedules

Your guides number is[masked] in case you can not find the group.


We are raising funds for the San Pedro Mission in the Dominican Republic.  100% of the proceeds will be donated to the mission. Suggested donation is $15 please bring cash or make check payable to CRC.
results.name: Private CRC Fall Foliage Central Park  History Tour

results.description:
Eat Village Tour.

This weekend is promised to be very warm. So, lets take a chance and learn something new about the city!

This tour is about East village. We will start from Tweed House, the great example of governmenor`s  greed. Then we will move up north through the court sector where you can learn about the famous court cases in the history, architecture of the buildings and place. Then we move to Chinatown where you can imagine the times of 1850 and notorious gangs of Five Points! The riots and crimes where happening there on each corner, and they still have their historic spirit. Then, we will walk to the Little Italy and visit the places of the infamous Italian gangsters, FBI surveillance, crime spots, stop by in Museum of American Italian, try Italian ice and cannoli ( only for the group minimum of 10 people). The end of the tour will be in SOHO with the story of uniqueness of this little part of the city.  

The damage (cost): just $10
results.name: TOUR! NYC Courts, Chinatown, Little Italy and SOHO!

English - Spanish - French -Italian - Portuguese - Chinese - Japanese - Korean - Russian - German - Arabic - Hebrew

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Join us for an evening of collaborative sound art and chaos poetry! 

In this Creative Safe-Space for the mad and mentally health-issued we will be exploring:

1. DADA POETRY

Dada was an artistic movement in the early 1900s that explored randomness, accidents, and incongruence. For this activity, we will be drawing inspiration from (though not necessarily copying) the following dada writing technique, invented by writer and performance artist Tristan Tzara:

Take a newspaper.
Take some scissors.
Choose from this paper an article the length you want to make your poem.
Cut out the article.
Next carefully cut out each of the words that make up this article and put them all in a bag.
Shake gently.
Next take out each cutting one after the other.
Copy conscientiously in the order in which they left the bag.
The poem will resemble you.
And there you are—an infinitely original author of charming sensibility, even though unappreciated by the vulgar herd.

2. COLLABORATIVE AUDIO COLLAGE

We will be creating live, generative sound collages by looping segments of audio and video we find on the internet. You may need to come to fully understand. Just come.

As always, there will be plenty of time to hang out and get to know one another during and after the event!

Hope to see you there!

-Josh K.

Note: the number of RSVPs for this event in this meetup is not representative of how many people will be at the actual event, as these events are being advertised in several ways outside of this meetup.
results.name: DADA POETRY + COLLABORATIVE AUDIO COLLAGE!

Join us for an evening of collaborative sound art and chaos poetry! In this Creative Safe-Space for individuals with past or present experience with mental health issues or extreme states we will be exploring:

1. DADA POETRY

Dada was an artistic movement in the early 1900s that explored randomness, accidents, and incongruence in general. For this activity, we will be drawing inspiration from (though not necessarily copying) the following dada writing technique, invented by writer and performance artist Tristan Tzara:

Take a newspaper.
Take some scissors.
Choose from this paper an article the length you want to make your poem.
Cut out the article.
Next carefully cut out each of the words that make up this article and put them all in a bag.
Shake gently.
Next take out each cutting one after the other.
Copy conscientiously in the order in which they left the bag.
The poem will resemble you.
And there you are—an infinitely original author of charming sensibility, even though unappreciated by the vulgar herd.


2. COLLABORATIVE AUDIO COLLAGE

We will be creating live, generative sound collages by looping segments of audio and video we find on the internet. You may need to come to fully understand. Just come.

As always there will be plenty of time to hang out and get to know each other during and after the event.

Hope to see you there!

-Josh K.

Note: the number of RSVPs for this event in this meetup is not representative of how many people will be at the actual event, as these events are being advertised in several ways outside of this meetup.

From Pussy Riot to Malala, few of today's struggles do not owe some debt to the unsung heroines of the international Suffragette Movement. These brave women were hugely influential allies in the abolitionist movement, and later the global labor movement. The struggle for women's liberation today continues to align closely w/ multiple social justice issues, not least of all human trafficking.


About the film:
Suffragette: tough questions disenfranchised despite earnest attempt

TRAILER:

https://youtu.be/056FI2Pq9RY

One of the more interesting critical reviews:
http://consequenceofsound.net/2015/10/film-review-suffragette/

results.description:
TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop・TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座


What's going on?

JCAG offers TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) and TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) workshops for all of you interested in preparing for the tests. The TOEFL tests and measures the ability to use English at the university level, and the TOEIC tests and measures the ability to use English in an international business environment.


(Details)


- TOEIC sessions are held once a month on the first Sunday, and the remaining Sundays are devoted to the TOEFL. This week, we are focusing on the speaking portion of the TOEFL test.


- The lessons focus on all the aspects of the tests (reading, writing, listening, and speaking) as well as other aspects such as pronunciation and composition ability in a focused yet fun and productive environment.

When & Where:

Date: Every other Sunday from 4:30pm-7:00pm

Location: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

Cost: These sessions are free of charge, but there is a suggested donation of $5 that will help to cover the cost of the printing materials.

To RSVP, email us at:　 [masked]


If you have any questions, please feel free to email us.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

 ****NOTE*****

1.) This event is run by JCAG organizers who are following a lesson plan that is prepared in advance, so we ask that native English speakers be aware of this when participating. 

2.) Due to the fact that the organizers dedicating their time to help with the event, we ask that people be considerate in terms of the time. Sessions will be cancelled in the event that students do not show up within 40 minutes of the start time.

皆様、

多くの方々のご希望や期待に応じて、我々JCAGはいよいよTOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)・TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) 対策の講座を開催致します。TOEFLは、英語圏の高等教育機関が入学希望者の外国語としての英語力を判定するための試験で、TOEICは英語によるコミュニケーション能力を検定するための試験です。


(内容)
レッスンはテスト(読解、ライティング、聴解、会話)に基づき集中したものになります。
又は発音、作文の強化等にも集中し、楽しみながら、効率的な環境でテストに励めるように指導致します。


日時と場所:


日時:日曜日の午後4時半～7時 (二週間ごとに二時間単位で行います)

場所: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

費用: イベントのご参加は無料ですが教材の出費を緩和致しますため、$5の推奨ドネーション額をお支払い下さい。

ご予約は以下まで: （予約なしでもご参加ＯＫです）
[masked]

ご質問のある方はメールまでお問い合わせください。

皆様のお越しをお待ちしております。
results.name: TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop ・ TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座

results.description:
Queen Salons are monthly gatherings designed for graduates of the 3-day Queen’s Code for Life workshop (formerly Celebrating Women: Regarding Ecstasy and Power™ workshop and commonly referred to as the “Queen Course”). If you have recently taken the Queen's Code for Life workshop and want to participate in the Queen Salons, please email <a>[masked]</a>. 

A Queen Salon is a safe and sacred space where you can connect with sister Queens, share your wisdom and energy, nurture and expand your Queen, and help each other embody your best and truest selves. We hope you will be excited to participate, create, laugh, and fill your tanks with your sister Queens in this loving Queen community.

In a Queen Salon, we will: 

• discuss and explore PAX material

• share personal triumphs and challenges

• strengthen our abilities to honor ourselves, our men, and our realms 

Join us for a casual evening of tank filling fun. 

This month's topic - Being a Queen of Compassion

Practicing Compassion for ourselves and others can create the space for deep understanding, appreciation and cooperation. It is a Feminine Form of Power which gives us access to being able to influence and contribute to our Realms. When directed inwardly, it can open new ways of honoring what really keeps us in “Queenly shape” and gaining awareness of what "throws us off". Let's go deep within ourselves as we look with compassionate eyes at ourselves and our Realms and explore the benefits of this Feminine Power.
results.name: Queen Salon - Topic: Being a Queen of Compassion

results.description:
This is a fun & unique event where you can go back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster. At the same time, make some new friends, meet some singles...and maybe more!

We will meet for a pre-mingle at 4:30pm at a local bar/pub near the museum, where we will hand out the tickets and head over to the museum at 5:30 for our 6pm private tour.

The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to buy ticket, closer to event date. Food/drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $29.75 to $39.75 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket). Must Prepay to attend. An RSVP alone will not hold your spot. 

Get your tickets ASAP at this link - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FiRbqNyVskg

About the Museum: 

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. 

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date
results.name: American Gangster Museum (Private Tour w/ Pre-Mingle) MUST PREPAY

About the Museum: 

Housed in a former speakeasy, the Museum of the American Gangster isn’t obvious on a casual stroll down St. Mark’s Place. If visitors know to look for number 80, though, they pass through a black gate and up a flight of stairs, where a plethora of artifacts and exhibits awaits. 

The museum focuses on American organized crime through the decades, which includes profiling mob bosses, Prohibition-era gangsters, serial bank robbers, and dastardly Scooby-Doo villains. 

The New York Times praised co-owner and tour guide Lorcan Otway as "so encyclopedic that touring the rooms takes hours," as he expounds upon America's unique relationship with hedonism and straight-laced morality. 

In the Wall Street Journal, correspondent Alexandra Cheney mentions noteworthy finds including the museum's genuine Tommy guns, vintage whiskey bottles, and old copper stills. 

GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/gangster/

Museum of the American Gangster Tour for Singles

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FiRbqNyVskg

This is a great event where you can step back in time and relive the days of the American Gangster.  At the same time, meet some fun singles, make some new friends and maybe more at this great  event.

==================================================== 

How it works 

The tour starts at 6 PM SHARP, however we will have a pre-mingle at 4:30  at a local bar/pub (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

Next we head to the museum for a Guided Group Tour.  

Note: This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. 

=============================================== 
Itinerary

4:30 PM- Premingle to meet other attendees

*6PM- Group Tour

==================================================

results.description:
Have you ever been to one of those escape games, where you have a solve a real-life puzzle with a group of friends (or strangers) before the time runs out?

I don't really want to go alone, but it totally looks like it's worth trying in a group!

You can read more and buy tickets here: https://goo.gl/ecQHQn

Here's their description:

Prepare for an hour of insane fun, team building, and laughter - as you are about to be trapped in a room with a zombie! (Please arrive 10-15min early. You will spend 60 min in room, with a 10 minute wrap up afterward. So budget 80-90 minutes!)

You and 11 other adventurers will enter a room and are challenged to find the clues, solve the riddles, and get the key to escape.... or get eaten. As the clock dwindles down from 60 to 0, every 5 minutes the hungry zombie's chain gets longer and the danger zone increases. Communication and teamwork are musts if you want to make it out alive.

Does that sound like fun? I definitely want to check it out!
results.name: Let's Try This Zombie Escape Game!

results.description:
Hello All!

I will be hosting a meet up for singers and acoustic musicians who would like to jam out and perhaps collaborate of future projects.

The meet up is held at my office which is 300 square feet filled with plenty of natural light and open space for up to 10 players comfortably.  I will have water on hand for the participants.

A cajon, bongos, mini conga and acoustic guitar will be available but I suggest you bring your own instrument.

Looking forward to it!!!
results.name: Intimate Acoustic Jam, Room for 10 people only

results.description:
Join us as we continue watch the Season 1 finale episodes as we continue our THRONES Countdown to Season 6!

We start with all of Season 1 and go straight through to the end of Season 5. Guess what? By the time we finish all five seasons together it will be time for Season 6!!! Yay! We can socialize  from 4:30PM to 5PM, then we begin the show at 5 promptly. A short intermission for reactions, then the second show. We have to clear out by 7:30PM.


This week we have:


Episode 9 ""Baelor""

Episode 10 "Fire and Blood"


All are welcome. If you have never watched Game of Thrones before and want to see what all the fuss is about, come on in and be enlightened. If you are a full fledged Maester trying to survive the Long Night between seasons come join us and watch the marvelous series again while vicariously enjoying the newbies reactions to the Game of Thrones.

NOTE- Newbies must identify themselves so us Maesters will have notice that you are there so we turn off MST3000 level of commentary!


This is a NEWBIE friendly event so our usual rules do not apply. Please no spoilers about the show or books in this newbie friendly environment (including this comment section). Anything already watched by the group as part of the Countdown is fair game to discuss by all, but no discussing the resolutions of things in the presence of our newbies. (Maesters will have their own anything goes events and time after the show). Newbies are of course welcome to theorize and forecast, but those of us who actually know "shall not pass" the information!


You can BYOF (bring your own food) and BYOB (bring your own beer and/or other drinks). There is a 7/11 on 33rd and Madison, a Wendys and a Smashburger and $1 Pizza on 33rd and 5th, and a Chipotle on 31st and Park (and other eats nearby too).
results.name: Game of Thrones Series Recap- Season 1 Finale Episodes 9 & 10

group.name: New York Game of Thrones Meetup

results.description:
Kirtan led by Kirtan Artist Stephen Browett. ​ Drawing​ ​on over 20 years study and practice of Yogananda’s teachings coupled with a​ ​contemporary​ ​sense of what it means to explore spirituality in the modern world​, ​Stephen has been using ​chants and affirmations ​to help overcome unhelpful mental patterns, develop heart qualities that speak to different aspects of the spiritual journey. He loves to bring people together to access calm, well-being and to feel uplifted.​ His passion is to make spirituality accessible and to connect to timeless practices that have been shown to be effective. He ​does ​this​ with a sense of humor, wonder and joy.

Join us for this inspiring event.

peace~

colleen

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .
results.name: Astoria Writers Write(!)
Bowl/Eat/Drink

results.description:
• PLEASE, PLEASE arrive ready to read at 5PM!

•  Pot-Luck--Please remember to bring something to eat or drink to share with the group at the break;

• Please arrive on time. Subways are erratic on Sundays. Check the MTA schedule, text--or call--if you arrive late[masked];

• Please bring your own script; 

• Please do not wear perfume, cologne etc as some of our regulars have allergies and we sit in close proximity to one another;

• PLEASE REMEMBER TO CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF YOUR PLANS CHANGE;

Characters

Act 1

Clive, a colonial administrator
Betty, his wife, played by a man
Joshua, his black servant, played by a white
Edward, his son, played by a woman
Victoria, his daughter, a ventriloquist's dummy
Maud, his mother-in-law
Ellen, Edward's governess
Harry Bagley, an explorer
Mrs. Saunders, a widow (played by the same actress who plays Ellen)

Act 2 (25 years later)

Betty, now played by a woman (normally the same actress who plays Edward)
Edward, her son, now played by a man (normally the same actor who plays Betty)
Victoria, her daughter (normally played by the same actress who plays Maud)
Martin, Victoria's husband (normally played by the same actor who plays Harry)
Lin, a lesbian single mother (normally played by the same actress who plays Ellen/Mrs. Saunders)
Cath, Lin's daughter, age 5, played by a man (normally the same actor who plays Clive)
Gerry, Edward's lover (normally played by the same actor who plays Joshua)

Cloud 9 is a two-act play written by British playwright Caryl Churchill, workshopped with the Joint Stock Theatre Company in late 1978 and premiered at Dartington College of Arts, Devon, on 14 February 1979.[1]

The two acts of the play form a contrapuntal structure. Act I is set in British colonial Africa in the Victorian era, and Act II is set in a London park in 1979. However, between the acts only twenty-five years pass for the characters. Each actor plays one role in Act I and a different role in Act II - the characters who appear in both acts are played by different actors in the first and second. Act I parodies the conventional comedy genre and satirizes Victorian society and colonialism. Act II shows what could happen when the restrictions of both the comic genre and Victorian ideology are loosened.

The play uses controversial portrayals of sexuality and obscene language, and establishes a parallel between colonial and sexual oppression.[2] Its humour depends on incongruity and the carnivalesque, and helps to convey Churchill's political message about accepting people who are different and not dominating them or forcing them into particular social roles.
results.how_to_find_us: F train to 7th Avenue Stop. If coming from Manhattan, be in the first car. RING BELL UP STOOP STEPS
results.name: Cloud 9

results.description:
Assalaamu 'alaykum Wa Rahmatullahi Wa Barakatuhu,

I pray to Allah that this email reaches you while you are in the highest status of Iman and happiness and enjoying the blessings of health and peace of mind.The  Hadra (zikr) starts at 5:30PM Insha Allah which is follow by a light snack Insha Allah and lesson.  See you at the dhikr insha Allah.

*Check out CNY's first Kickstarter Campaign!

----

• What is truth? How is it found? How do we know what we believe is true? Can truth change?


• Is happiness necessary? What is true happiness? Is happiness sustainable?

• Is there such a thing as a soul-mate or is it just a gimmick of the romance novels? How do you know if the one you love is your soul-mate?  Can a couple grow to become each other's soul-mate?

Join us for sea air and conversation while sailing on the Staten Island Ferry.

--Greet old friends and meet new ones.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
